column7:
Our client is a premier provider of specialty polymer formulations, color and additive systems, packaging solutions, and polymer distribution. Currently, they are looking for a Python developer to join their team.
Job Details:
Salary Range: $6000-$7000 (depends on experience)
Working Hour: Monday to Thursday (8.30am-5.45pm); Friday (8.30am-5.15pm)
Location: Jurong East (West area)
AWS + 2-4 months Variable Bonus
Annual leave 14 days, Flexi benefit of $300 per year and Group insurance
Purpose of job:
We are looking for an experienced Python developer to join the digital and innovation team. They will work closely with the data analyst & science and development team to empower our backend services. They will also have opportunities to work on full stack development, cloud computing, micro-service, big data, and other modern technology topics.
Web Service and Application Development
Develop and maintain the Python Engine responsible for managing the formulation database of InstaColr
Constantly improve the quality of the results and the processing speed of the engine
Gradually increase the scope and complexity of the engine as required by the business
Develop and maintain the formula prediction services with the data science team
Data Management
Assist the data team with implementation of automated ETL
Remove corrupted data and fix coding errors and related problems
Monitor the data pipeline, ensure it is always ready to use
Develop and maintain databases and data systems
Competency Centre Management
Propose and develop new approaches in the field of digitization, implement new technologies
Advise stakeholders of capability and possible solutions to business challenges
Establish working relationships with key business stakeholders and an understanding of business models
Utilize information of product to value-add to the software development
Software Management
Ensure responsible management of the software quality
Regular review on software architecture to ensure the technical governance is followed
Monitors, evaluates, and ensures the completion of tasks and projects
Documentation of software development
Requirement
Bachelor degree holder in Computer Science, IT, Electrical Engineering or Electronics Engineering or related
Experience with web development, web performance optimization techniques
In-depth understanding of web frameworks such as Flask, Django, etc
Solid computer science fundamentals in algorithms and data structures
Experience with REST API and SQL
Interested applicants please send your resume to [HIDDEN TEXT] or whatsapp to wa.me/6598955132. Regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by our consultants.
Align Recruitment Pte Ltd (20C0253)
Lim Hui Min (Ailsa) (Reg No. R2094728)

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud spans 84 Availability Zones within 26 geographic regions around the world, with announced plans for 24 more Availability Zones and 8 more AWS Regions in Australia, Canada, India, Israel, New Zealand, Spain, Switzerland, and United Arab Emirates (UAE). This makes AWS one of the fastest growing enterprise tech companies ever. Amazon's AWS Data Centers (DC) are a major component of worldwide cloud-computing infrastructure and are industry leading examples of mission critical facilities.

AWS Engineering is responsible for the design of all architectural, electrical, mechanical, structural and controls systems within all of Amazon DCs world-wide. The team works directly with operations, security teams, field engineering, and construction management to implement designs that are functional, practical and innovative.

The team is seeking a Document Controller to become part of our global engineering team.

Key job responsibilities
The Document Controller will be responsible for the following:
. Review all documentation being issued by the design team, including but not limited to narratives, drawings, sheets, etc.
. Controlling the numbering, naming, filing and formatting of all documents issued by the design engineering team.
. Developing and setting standards for engineering document control, and best practices. Drives process improvements across the organization.
. Developing document tracking processes
. Creating document lists
. Distributing and uploading all project documentation to assigned locations
. Ensuring all technical documents are uploaded
. Giving access to project folders for appropriate team members
. Acting as central point of contact for engineering drawings for APAC projects
. Keeping and managing database for all projects
. Other document administration related to engineering team
. Working with internal teams to understand project requirement

A day in the life
As a Document Controller you will be part of a highly creative and effective design team comprised of Architects, Civil, Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, Controls, Information Communication and Telecommunications and Physical Security Engineers tasked with developing documentation tracking tools, reviewing every technical document, drawing or sheet being issued by the design team and storing it properly within the assigned document repository. You will be responsible for all of the project documentation being issued by the design team, and providing document guidance to all team members.

About the team
Engineers in AWS work to design resilient, cost effective DC facilities. We are responsible for achieving a world class uptime for our customers and drive to develop a fleet of buildings emphasizing security, safety, and efficiency, while finding new ways to meet AWS's growing demand. We justify and communicate the technical decisions we make directly to AWS leadership and work hard to drive continuous advancements in our designs. Engineers on our team have the opportunity to impact changes in our current design, as well as establish design procedures and protocols for future systems.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Cumulative 3+ years of experience with document control
. Advanced experience with MS Office and MS Excel
. Data organization skills
. Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree in engineering
. Understanding of technical documentation
. Understanding of project management
. Experience with AutoCAD or BIM
. Understanding of data centers and its critical components
. 2+ years of experience related to industry infrastructure or mission critical facility design

Amazon is a committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Category
SalesJob Details

Position: Enterprise Account Executive, Vietnam - BASED IN SINGAPORE
IMPORTANT NOTE: SUCCESSFUL HIRE MUST BE RESIDING IN SINGAPORE OR WILLING TO RELOCATE TO SINGAPORE WITHIN 30-45 DAYS OF ACCEPTING AN OFFER. WE WILL ASSIST WITH RELOCATION AND VISA PROCESSING.

The Enterprise Account Executive maintains and expands relationships with strategically important and large enterprises. Assigned to a number of named customers, the enterprise account executive is responsible for achieving sales quota and assigned strategic account objectives as well as developing business within some white space accounts.

Responsibilities:
- Establish professional and deep relationships with key personnel in assigned customer accounts
- Leads account planning process that develops account strategy, financial targets and critical milestones for 1-3 year period
- Leads cross functional team within Salesforce to meet customer accounts performance objectives and expectations
- Deep understanding of customer's business environment, proactively assesses, clarifies and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis.
- Leads solution development efforts that best address customer needs and generating pipeline for the Salesforce
- Engage with prospect organizations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data.
- Manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Co-Primes, Executives, Partners etc.
- Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation.
- Accurate quarterly forecasting and revenue delivery.

Requirements:

- 10+ years relevant experience of solution selling within a major services or software vendor.
- Candidate must have extensive experience selling into the Vietnam market.
- Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets
- Credibility at all levels, including CxO.
- CRM application sales, relevant enterprise experience preferred.
- Must speak highly fluent Vietnamese as this person will be traveling regularly and selling to customers in Vietnam. Fluent English is also required.

About Salesforce:
Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas-a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes World's Most Innovative Company five years in a row and one of Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for family) made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.
*LI-MB #LI-HAN #LI-HCMAccommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this .Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
and are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. column1: Business Insights Analyst, APJ SSOE Business Insights and Advanced Analytics Team
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services, Inc. (AWS) enables customers of all s to run their applications on Amazon's industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform. This growth is driving the need for an experienced Business Insights Analyst. Amazon has a strong culture of data-driven decision-making requiring timely, accurate, and actionable intelligence that delivers significant business value. We are looking for a hands-on and motivated self-starter who is passionate about using data to help us measure every area of the business and influence decision-making.

In this role, the Business Insights Analyst serves as the subject matter expert to fulfil data-driven decision making demands. As the successful candidate, you must be able to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large and complex datasets. You will continuously evolve business reporting, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting and analytical tools, and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity.

You will be passionate about your work, detail-oriented, analytical, and possess creative problem-solving abilities. You will need to demonstrate subject matter expertise in querying and extracting large datasets and the accompanying tools and programming languages needed to work with them. You will possess good communication and project management skills, is customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights both verbally and in writing in a clear and precise manner.

Main responsibilities:
. Lead the development of self-service reporting and analysis by creating and owning business reports and insight products
. Conduct data analysis to solve business problems through the use of statistical and/or machine learning models
. Continuously sharpen the skillset by learning and maintaining knowledge of existing and emerging business intelligence tools
. Collaborate with the internal and global data engineering teams on the design, development and maintenance of data infrastructure including data models
. Collaborate with the internal and worldwide data science teams on the design, development and maintenance of statistical and/or artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree with emphasis on statistical and analytical skills
. Proficiency in relational databases (Redshift, RDS, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.) and SQL for querying and extracting data
. Proficiency in at least programming languages (Python, Java, R, etc.) for data gathering, data cleansing and statistical analysis
. Expertise in data visualisation software (QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.) for effective data presentation
. Creative and analytical thinking to generate interesting approaches to answering business questions
. Strong and effective written and oral communication to clearly convey data findings
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of work experience as a Business Analyst
. Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial
. Proficiency in different types of databases (relational vs. non-relational, etc.) and their relevant use cases
. Experience working with Cloud Computing
. Experience in deploying artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models into production
. AWS certified (AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate, AWS Certified Data Analytics, etc.)
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column1: Telecom Data & Analytics Business Development Leader, APJ
column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Would you like to enable some of the largest telecom operators in the world transform the ways in which they use data for predicting customer needs, preventing inefficiencies and delivering personalized experiences Have you been a part of creating and delivering digital and analytics strategies for major Telcos

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and the leader in providing secure, reliable, scalable, and innovative cloud services that help businesses across the globe scale and grow. The AWS Telecom Business Development team is looking for an experienced candidate to lead Data Management and Analytics Go-To-Market, driving significant adoption of data, analytics and AI/ML solutions for our largest telecom customers.

This is a senior role, with an Asia-Pacific remit, to guide customers in accelerating their digital transformations by building data-driven organizations, and enabling business outcomes leveraging AWS database, analytics, AI and ML technologies. You will help our telecom customers accelerate this journey by engaging with the customers business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment helping them learn from examples of industry leaders, reference architectures and define what great looks like for their data-driven enterprise.

This role may be located in Sydney or Singapore, and will strive to create alignment among customer stakeholders, address resistance to change and provide a tangible, executable vision to transition to a cloud computing model. They will operate effectively at multiple levels of the organization and can address concerns across C-suite executives, marketing/LOB leaders, data science practitioners, and established platform teams.

You will represent the AWS telecom data strategy and be the leading voice for AWS telecom data-focused solutions. You will leverage worldwide programs, campaigns and work closely with the wider AWS business development, product management, marketing, solutions architecture, partner and professional services teams to position the AWS telecom data strategy for telecom customers and partners.

The ideal candidate will possess a telecommunications business- and data analytics background (preferably including machine learning), with a foundation of having directly led sales / pre-sales / consulting engagements and interactions at the highest levels of large telecom operators and technology partners. The candidate should have proven expertise at thought leadership, conceptualizing customer-centric solutions, convincing C-Level executives, line of business leaders and IT architects, and having seen through successful sales to delivery cycles.

Additionally, the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, telecom enterprise applications, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation/shaping, with an awareness of field enablement techniques.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
Basic Qualifications :
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
* 15+ years of experience in client related interactions, including executive presentations, relationship management, deal structuring and commercials negotiation, including working with partners in a consortium framework
* 10+ years of related experience in data management and data architecture
* 3+ years experience in analytics roadmaps, including machine learning
* Experience managing / advising on data operations, data strategy, data governance, metadata management, or data quality management discipline
Preferred Qualifications :
* Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or applicable field, or MBA
* Experience creating and executing organizational change management strategies as part of a larger transformation
* Program oversight experience in a Sales / Business Development capacity, including planning, prioritization, successful project completion and maintaining a focus on high standards and quality
* Experience with machine learning
* Experience with data architecture, data system and tools, related software, and data management policies and practices in a complex organizational environment
* Experience in evaluating on-premise vs cloud computing models
* AWS Cloud certifications

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column6: Information Security  Information Technology  Iso 27001  Penetration Testing  Encryption  Network Security  External Audit  Risk Assessment  Active Directory  Iso  Physical Security  Administration  Compliance  Audits  Audit  security awareness
column7:
BIPO Service Singapore is looking for an experienced Information Security Manager to lead information security, compliance audit, and personal data privacy activities.
Responsibilities
Lead compliance audit activities (SOC, ISO 27001) for BIPO Singapore, Hong Kong, and China
Responsible for BIPO data privacy, serving in BIPO's Data Privacy team and answer internal and external queries related to BIPO's compliance to data privacy laws / regulations
Lead internal audit activities as required
Formulation, review, and update of Information Security-related company policies
Formulating security baselines, configuring, using security/audit product, solution (e.g., CyberArk, Netwrix Audit, Microsoft 365 )
Managing staff information security and data privacy awareness trainings
Be responsible for data privacy and security in general
Responding to customers questions / security questionnaires related to data privacy / security and support relevant RFP preparation in this area
Lead security / compliance projects (e.g., vulnerability scans, penetration testing)
Manage security of BIPO HRMS servers, define security baseline for servers and application
Responsible for respond to security incidents.
Regular review of effectiveness of security systems, e.g., Cloudflare WAF, Crowdstrike, Comodo AV, PRTG alerting, database encryption, Wifi and network security, physical security, and feedback improvement to IT infra team.
Regular review of compliance activities done by IT infra team to ensure successful external audit, e.g., review of access logs for security breaches, user access reviews, firewall reviews, PC audits)
Performs other duties as assigned related to information security.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or equivalent field of study
Experience in all or some of these: maintaining ISO 27001 system, responding to information security audit questions, formulating IT security policies, performing risk assessment and business impact analysis, performing system vulnerability assessments, reviewing user activities, network firewall configuration, managing system security patches and server hardening, having work experience with security products (e.g. SIEM, CyberArk, application firewalls, vulnerability scanners, endpoint security / DLP solutions), disaster recovery planning, managing user information security awareness training, remediating penetration testing findings, and performing incident analysis, response and reporting.
Preferably strong hands-on technical skills in IT infrastructure (e.g., server administration, network/system security, disaster recovery, system high availability, backup operations, system monitoring, network /system troubleshooting, storage administration, incident response, change management, patch management, IT audit).
Strong English writing skills, good documentation and effective communication skills, ability to interact with a range of people.
Good project management skills, problem solving skills, documentation skills, preferably with experience in IT infrastructure support (Windows server, SQL Server, Active Directory & DNS, IIS web server, WSUS, Anti-Virus, Firewall, Network equipment, Office 365, PC support, Cloud computing). Experience in AWS cloud computing advantageous.
Responsible, resourceful, effective, detail oriented, able to work and pick up new skills independently and meet deadlines. Able to respond to critical system alerts and be contactable for urgent issues outside office hours.
Fluency in Chinese language advantageous.

Are you a seasoned technical program manager ready to support the largest and most complex customers in their journey to the cloud Azure is the fastest growing business in Microsoft's history and is the foundation of Microsoft's commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper-scale, enterprise-grade cloud that has a true hybrid story. The Azure (Networking, Compute, Storage) Team is responsible for accelerating our most strategic customers adoption of Microsoft Azure by connecting our technical experience, along with our customers vision and challenges directly to the engineering product teams, and as a result help to ensure Azure is the most compelling solution on the market. We work across a broad range of Azure technologies understanding customer scenarios, cloud patterns and adoption blockers.
As we drive to be the leading cloud platform in the world, Azure Sovereign Cloud team is hiring an exceptional technical program manager to help support our most complex and challenging customers and engineering programs in the Government landscape. #aznetPM

Success in this role combines managing customer engagements, listening to and understanding customer use cases and scenarios, translating these into viable cloud infrastructure and communicating this at an executive level. Responsibilities include program management of technical delivery teams on proof-of-concept implementations, as well as architecture design and review in a cloud-scale, cloud-pace environment. Close collaboration with generalists and specialists in the Microsoft field and delivery teams, peer teams within Microsoft Engineering and diverse customer teams is critical. The role is also responsible for communications related to our programs of work, including executive reporting and reviews with both customer and Microsoft stakeholders.
This position is located in Singapore and some travel will be required (0%-25%).
The successful candidate will have experience in cloud-scale network service projects and launches, as well as direct customer engagement and be able to take a collaborative approach to solving problems. They will fit comfortably into an ambitious and challenging environment and have strong verbal and written communication skills. They will be objective, self-disciplined and possess excellent business and technical judgement, and be able to operate autonomously. A critical part of the role is the ability to conceptualize complex ideas quickly and convey those thoughts to others in a clear, effective, and motivating manner. Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
To contribute as a key member of the team, the successful candidate must be eager to take on and lead initiatives, be an open communicator, have a commitment to excellence and possess a strong sense of personal commitment in accomplishing both customer and Microsoft goals.

requiredqualifications:
citizenship is required
5+ years of program management experience or other technology related experience
understanding of cloud computing technologies and business drivers
experience in cloud-scale network infrastructure and delivery
experience working with public sector entities at the national level
demonstrated customer focus and end-to-end thinking across teams and experiences
track record of high-quality, self-directed, timely execution, and attention to detail
success in consultative and engagement management with sophisticated and complex customers and projects.
experience in relationship management across diverse multi-national/multi-disciplinary teams
demonstrate effective time and deliverable management
strong communication acumen, both verbal and written up to an executive-level
highly effective collaboration and team building skills

preferred qualifications:
ability to meet microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. these requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings:
microsoft cloud background check: this position will be required to pass the microsoft cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
singapore security clearance cat or cat2+ a bonus

Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world's leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing startups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation.

At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in ASEAN. Learn more about a career opportunity as a Demand Generation Representative (DGR) at AWS ASEAN.

As a DGR for the Indonesian Enterprise market, you are an important member of the sales and marketing organization. You will be the frontline for our enterprise customers in their new/early stage of cloud adoption, and connect their key stakeholders to AWS. This role will actively identify and hunt key decision makers from targeted customers and leverage lead sources from various AWS marketing, sales, and external databases and help the customers start their transformational journey. DGR will profile, nurture and qualify customer leads by understanding their business issues and proposing solutions to their problems with AWS services. This role is our brand custodian who will support our customers, partners and end-users as they work with AWS and utilize our cloud technology to innovate and improve their business outcomes.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
As builders, we are here to build long-term relationships with our customers. In this role, you will Learn and Be Curious (see Amazon Leadership Principles) about the entire portfolio of AWS products and services. As a trusted advisor who is Customer Obsessed, you will listen to our customers to understand their needs, and propose AWS solutions who can solve their problems. Through customer engagements, you will identify potential sales opportunities with effective questioning and listening skills. With a strong Bias for Action, once you have qualified sales opportunities, you will follow the opportunity management processes to ensure that opportunities are handed over to appropriate sales team members, so that we can address our customers needs in a timely manner. Your success will be measured by the achievement of your opportunity creation goals.

Want to know more about what it's like to be part of our ASEAN Team at AWS Hear from our builders: ASEAN Builders

Basic Qualifications
. Professional fluency in English and Bahasa Indonesia, both written and verbal
. Experiences in sales or demand generation within the technology sector
. Sales/business development experience with Indonesian enterprise customers
. Proven success in managing time and juggling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment where priorities shift quickly
. Clear, concise and confident communicator in-person and via phone
. Ability to profile customers from various internal/external sources to attain key business contacts
. Ability to listen to customers, understand needs, and ask clarifying/probing questions.
. Ability to think logically and structure answers, and ability to deal with ambiguity.

Preferred Qualifications
. Degree or technical background in engineering, computer science, or technology specialization (Big Data, Analytics, AI, Digital Transformation, Machine Learning)
. Foundational knowledge and understanding of existing and developing technologies that relate to cloud computing
. Experience navigating prospective accounts to reach senior executive levels to identify new customer opportunities
. Skilled at presenting technical solutions to prospects and customers

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Basic Qualifications :
Basic Qualifications
. Professional fluency in English and Bahasa Indonesia, both written and verbal
. Experiences in sales or demand generation within the technology sector
. Sales/business development experience with Indonesian enterprise customers
. Proven success in managing time and juggling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment where priorities shift quickly
. Clear, concise and confident communicator in-person and via phone
. Ability to profile customers from various internal/external sources to attain key business contacts
. Ability to listen to customers, understand needs, and ask clarifying/probing questions.
. Ability to think logically and structure answers, and ability to deal with ambiguity.
Preferred Qualifications :

Preferred Qualifications

. Foundational knowledge and understanding of existing and developing technologies that relate to cloud computing
. Experience navigating prospective accounts to reach senior executive levels to identify new customer opportunities
. Skilled at presenting technical solutions to prospects and customers

column1: Telecom BSS/OSS Business Development Leader, ASEAN
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Would you like to enable transformations at some of the largest telecom operators in the world Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and the leader in providing secure, reliable, scalable, and innovative cloud services that help businesses across the globe scale and grow. The AWS Telecom Business Development team is looking for a seasoned Telecom industry leader with experience in advising, winning and delivering innovative network transformation solutions for Telecom service providers.

This is a senior role within the Asia-Pacific & Japan (APJ) team, to guide customers in accelerating their digital transformations by building networks that leverage a software-based architecture, and enabling business outcomes leveraging AWS telecom-supportive technologies. You will help our telecom customers accelerate this journey by engaging with the customers business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision AWS services in their environment helping them learn from examples of industry leaders, reference architectures and define what great looks like for their enterprise.

This role may be located in Singapore, Jakarta, Kuala Lumpur or Manila, and will strive to create alignment among customer stakeholders, address resistance to change and provide a tangible, executable vision to transition to a cloud computing model. This leader will operate effectively at multiple levels of the organization and can address concerns across C-suite executives, IT/Network/Procurement leaders and established platform teams.

Areas of expertise will include most of the following:

* In-depth understanding across Telecommunications systems, standards & processes
* Granular understanding of the economics of network operations including BSS/OSS considerations and Telco IT strategy
* Deep familiarity with OSS, Multi-Mediation, Multi-Activation, Service Orchestration, offline and online Billing, Order management and customer experience management domains.
* Firm grasp of Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and various Virtual Network Function (VNF) technologies
* Executive level network transformation proposal structuring, presentation & negotiation, including in consortiums with partners

You will represent the AWS telecom strategy and be the leading voice for AWS telecom-focused solutions. You will leverage worldwide programs, campaigns and work closely with the wider AWS business development, product management, marketing, solutions architecture, partner and professional services teams to position the AWS telecom data strategy for telecom customers and partners.

Responsibilities will include:

* Providing business transformation and digital technology adoption thought leadership to Telecom customers & partners
* Conducting C-level executive workshops engaging and leading strategic discussions with senior telecom industry leaders regarding networks transformation
* Helping Telcos identify transformational opportunities and driving adoption of AWS solutions
* Identifying and scoping high impact transformation solutions with measurable business results for our customers
* Drive lighthouse OSS and BSS transformations leveraging cloud infrastructure and operating principles
* Work with multiple sales and technical teams within AWS and global technology solution providers for OSS and BSS applications to define and execute GTM initiatives.
* Engage each technology solution provider's field sales organizations, channels and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for AWS. Ensure that there is a strategic business development plan for target markets, aligned with AWS strategic direction.
* Inventing and delivering new offers, collaborating with AWS professional services, service teams, partners, and Amazon product teams
* Providing telco thought leadership by participating in industry conferences and executive briefings
* Supporting client engagements within the assigned territory and influencing activities at our Geo Accounts
* Supporting our AWS Partner Network and key industry ISVs with their Telco solutions on AWS

The ideal candidate will possess a foundation of having directly led sales / pre-sales / consulting engagements and interactions at the highest levels of large telecom operators and technology partners. The candidate should have proven expertise at thought leadership, conceptualizing customer-centric solutions, convincing C-Level executives, CIOs/CTOs & line of business leaders and IT architects, and having seen through successful sales to delivery cycles.

Additionally, the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global telecom businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, telecom enterprise applications, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation/shaping, with an awareness of field enablement techniques.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
* 15+ years of experience in client related interactions, including executive presentations, relationship management, deal structuring and commercials negotiation, including working with partners in a consortium framework
* Strong understanding of Telco IT and digital transformation, including the role of cloud, data strategy, AI/ML
* Demonstrated ability and track record leading Telco sales growth within a cross-functional team (direct reporting and virtual), in complex client engagements
* Track record of building rapport with senior partner and customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO), building close relationships, and closing large revenue accounts.
* 7+ years experience with $100M+ deals in the Telco sector in sales or business development capacity
* Demonstrated experience designing winning proposals to address the re-architecture of legacy BSS/OSS platforms to be run on public cloud.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Telco industry Business and Technical expertise across IT, OSS/BSS architectures and workloads, including ERP, CRM, Billing, Charging, Order Management, Catalogue Management, Mediation, Provisioning, Activation, Inventory Management, Service Assurance, Fault & Performance Management, Data Warehousing, Decision Support System, EAI/ESB Solutions
* Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or applicable field, or MBA
* Experience creating and executing organizational change management strategies as part of a larger transformation
* Program oversight experience in a Sales / Business Development capacity, including planning, prioritization, successful project completion and maintaining a focus on high standards and quality across own organization and partners
* Experience in evaluating on-premise vs cloud computing models

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column1: Business Insights Analyst, APJ SSOE Business Insights and Advanced Analytics Team
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services, Inc. (AWS) enables customers of all s to run their applications on Amazon's industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform. This growth is driving the need for an experienced Business Insights Analyst. Amazon has a strong culture of data-driven decision-making requiring timely, accurate, and actionable intelligence that delivers significant business value. We are looking for a hands-on and motivated self-starter who is passionate about using data to help us measure every area of the business and influence decision-making.

In this role, the Business Insights Analyst serves as the subject matter expert to fulfil data-driven decision making demands. As the successful candidate, you must be able to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large and complex datasets. You will continuously evolve business reporting, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting and analytical tools, and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity.

You will be passionate about your work, detail-oriented, analytical, and possess creative problem-solving abilities. You will need to demonstrate subject matter expertise in querying and extracting large datasets and the accompanying tools and programming languages needed to work with them. You will possess good communication and project management skills, is customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights both verbally and in writing in a clear and precise manner.

Main responsibilities:
. Lead the development of self-service reporting and analysis by creating and owning business reports and insight products
. Conduct data analysis to solve business problems through the use of statistical and/or machine learning models
. Continuously sharpen the skillset by learning and maintaining knowledge of existing and emerging business intelligence tools
. Collaborate with the internal and global data engineering teams on the design, development and maintenance of data infrastructure including data models
. Collaborate with the internal and worldwide data science teams on the design, development and maintenance of statistical and/or artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree with emphasis on statistical and analytical skills
. Proficiency in relational databases (Redshift, RDS, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.) and SQL for querying and extracting data
. Proficiency in at least programming languages (Python, Java, R, etc.) for data gathering, data cleansing and statistical analysis
. Expertise in data visualisation software (QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.) for effective data presentation
. Creative and analytical thinking to generate interesting approaches to answering business questions
. Strong and effective written and oral communication to clearly convey data findings
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of work experience as a Business Analyst
. Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial
. Proficiency in different types of databases (relational vs. non-relational, etc.) and their relevant use cases
. Experience working with Cloud Computing
. Experience in deploying artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models into production
. AWS certified (AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate, AWS Certified Data Analytics, etc.)
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Job summary
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud spans 84 Availability Zones within 26 geographic regions around the world, with announced plans for 24 more Availability Zones and 8 more AWS Regions in Australia, Canada, India, Israel, New Zealand, Spain, Switzerland, and United Arab Emirates (UAE). This makes AWS one of the fastest growing enterprise tech companies ever. Amazon's AWS Data Centers (DC) are a major component of worldwide cloud-computing infrastructure and are industry leading examples of mission critical facilities.

AWS Engineering is responsible for the design of all architectural, electrical, mechanical, structural and controls systems within all of Amazon DCs world-wide. The team works directly with operations, security teams, field engineering, and construction management to implement designs that are functional, practical and innovative.

The team is seeking a Document Controller to become part of our global engineering team.

Key job responsibilities
The Document Controller will be responsible for the following:
. Review all documentation being issued by the design team, including but not limited to narratives, drawings, sheets, etc.
. Controlling the numbering, naming, filing and formatting of all documents issued by the design engineering team.
. Developing and setting standards for engineering document control, and best practices. Drives process improvements across the organization.
. Developing document tracking processes
. Creating document lists
. Distributing and uploading all project documentation to assigned locations
. Ensuring all technical documents are uploaded
. Giving access to project folders for appropriate team members
. Acting as central point of contact for engineering drawings for APAC projects
. Keeping and managing database for all projects
. Other document administration related to engineering team
. Working with internal teams to understand project requirement

A day in the life
As a Document Controller you will be part of a highly creative and effective design team comprised of Architects, Civil, Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, Controls, Information Communication and Telecommunications and Physical Security Engineers tasked with developing documentation tracking tools, reviewing every technical document, drawing or sheet being issued by the design team and storing it properly within the assigned document repository. You will be responsible for all of the project documentation being issued by the design team, and providing document guidance to all team members.

About the team
Engineers in AWS work to design resilient, cost effective DC facilities. We are responsible for achieving a world class uptime for our customers and drive to develop a fleet of buildings emphasizing security, safety, and efficiency, while finding new ways to meet AWS's growing demand. We justify and communicate the technical decisions we make directly to AWS leadership and work hard to drive continuous advancements in our designs. Engineers on our team have the opportunity to impact changes in our current design, as well as establish design procedures and protocols for future systems.
Basic Qualifications :
. Cumulative 3+ years of experience with document control
. Advanced experience with MS Office and MS Excel
. Data organization skills
. Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards
Preferred Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree in engineering
. Understanding of technical documentation
. Understanding of project management
. Experience with AutoCAD or BIM
. Understanding of data centers and its critical components
. 2+ years of experience related to industry infrastructure or mission critical facility design

Amazon is a committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column1: Solution Sales Specialist - SAP on Azure
column7:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

Responsibilities
Core accountabilities include
Generate SAP on Azure consumption revenue in assigned territory. (SAP S/4 HANA deployment on Azure IaaS, Rise with SAP on Azure, HEC on Azure)
Drive wins in high-potential customers to accelerate new customer adds & associated revenue.
50% of your time will be spent leading business level dialogue with customers around the SAP workloads, including Business transformation for enterprise computing and digital transformation. You will engage Microsoft account and solution sales teams on assessing SAP solution strategy with a broad set of customers in a geographical region, and present to customers in one-many venues on the Microsoft Solution Strategy for SAP
30% of your time will be spent on acting as a senior Sales and solution SME (Subject Matter Expert) to Sales teams, Cloud Architects and Solution Specialists and develop engagement approaches leveraging assets across Microsoft SAP Architects, Product Teams and Engineering. You will brief Microsoft Executives around complex sales opportunities, including competitive strategies and close plans and work with partners to engage customers with joint value positioning.
20% of your time will be spent on influencing the Microsoft Azure SAP go-to-market strategies by providing feedback to sales, marketing, and engineering on current and future product requirements and sales blockers. You will be recognized for sharing, learning and driving work that results in business impact for customers, partners and Microsoft. We encourage thought leadership, and we encourage all our employees to continuously maintain and enhance their technical, sales, professional skills and competitive readiness. You will therefore be required to attain and maintain required certifications.

professional
experience: 10+ years enterprise technology sales/pre-sales or consulting experience with deep expertise on sap solutions - s/4 hana, pce (private cloud edition), hec (hana enterprise cloud), sap netweaver and sap business technology platform(btp) experience required (mandatory)
strong knowledge in public cloud market (mandatory)
expertise in enterprise solution selling techniques and selling cloud-based solutions.
strong understanding of cloud consumption economics.
growth mindset: ability to overcome and work around problems that are inevitable in rapidly growing businesses - positive approach to problem solving, learning, and development of potential.
account management: 10+ years effective territory/account management and leading sales teams: planning, opportunity qualification and creation, stakeholder and executive communication, needs analysis, value engineering, services/partner engagement, opportunity management and proposal response, pipeline management, large dollar licensing and deal negotiation required.
executive presence: 10+ years experience and expertise selling to c-suite and executive business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the value of azure sap to the customer's overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria. required
problem solver: ability to solve customer problems through cloud technologies required
leadership: experience leading large cloud engagements, especially those involving infrastructure modernization and migration preferred
collaborative. orchestrate and influence virtual teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead v-teams.
communication: executive level speaking and presentation skills, and good written communication skills
partners. deep partner engagement and management skills with sap focused practices.
exceptional demonstrated decision-making, conflict resolution, problem solving and negotiation skills.
technical
cloud computing infrastructure basic (mandatory): server, storage, nw, security area
sap: s/4 hana including sap pce (private cloud edition), sap hana, sap suite on hana, ecc and sap bw required (mandatory).
understanding of microsoft products and/or complementing solutions
competitive landscape. knowledge of enterprise software solutions, cloud, and data center infrastructure competitor landscape
sap hana certification/migration specialist certification preferred.
understanding of azure platform or what's equivalent (azure admin associate or architect certification is preferred or azure for sap workload specialty )

column6: Account Executive  Commercial  Philippines
column7:
Job Category
SalesJob Details

Account Executive, Commercial, Philippines

We are seeking proven sales performers to help us grow our loyal customer base for our Commercial division. This is a role for someone who is a hunter and hungry for new business success. Responsibilities include generating new business in new accounts and also expanding the footprint inside existing customers, as well as playing a key role as you drive strategic CRM initiatives for our customers. This is a role for someone who can see the value of Cloud Computing and who can be a combination salesperson and evangelist to get the Salesforce penetration into the sector growing even more. On top of your own business development, we provide a range of support functions to help create and drive opportunities from internal sales support to highly skilled pre-sales so it is not just you against the world.

Responsibilities:
Developing and managing relationships within our Commercial segment focusing on customers in the Philippines.
Managing complex sales-cycles and presenting to C-level executives the value of our enterprise suite of applications.
Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement in Salesforce while creating satisfied and reference-able customers.
Demonstrating our product via the Web.


Requirements:
6-9 years of experience carrying quota and closing deals in software (business applications preferred) or technology sales.
Extensive experience selling to customers in Philippines.
Consistently over-achieved quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions.
Successful track-record managing complex deals from lead to close.
Fluency in English required.
Business-level fluency in Tagalog would be a plus as this person will be traveling regularly and selling to customers in the Philippines.


Desired Skills
Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communications skills.
Previous Sales Methodology training preferred.
CRM experience preferred.
Ability to work in a fast pace, team environment.
Strong customer references.
Strong computer skills, including CRM, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel.

*LI-Y #LI-MANAccommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this .Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. Salesforce welcomes all.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Are you passionate about operational excellence, including cost optimisation Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale challenges in the world today Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners that use cloud computing services to run their solutions reliably, securely, efficiently and at lower cost

At AWS Enterprise Support we are looking for a Senior Specialist Technical Account Manager (STAM) to provide unique deep-dive technical engagements for our Enterprise customers across Asia-Pacific, Japan and China (APJC). Based in Singapore (part of the ASEAN team), you will be a member of a dynamic team bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies, focussed on the difficult cost and agility challenges facing many organisations.

You will provide strategic people, process and technology guidance to proactively improve performance, reliability, security and cost-effectiveness of customers solutions using AWS best practices. This role will focus on providing customers with AWS Cloud Operations best practices for Cost Optimisation, Monitoring and Observability, People and Process, Incident Management, Disaster Recover, Continuous Improvement and other DevSecOps topics.

About the team
*Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

*Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

*Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 6+ years of technical engineering experience
* Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience as a technical lead

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Software development experience in automation, infrastructure-as-code, tools and dashboards. Experience in a high-level programing language such as Python, Golang or Java
* Internal enterprise experience working with a wide range of internal stakeholders on operations implementation or migration with a company-wide impact.
* Ability to understand complex cloud environments and bridge the gap between technical and business requirements
* Track record of implementing cloud best practices (provisioning, deployment, monitoring using AGILE / Devops methodologies and tools) for enterprise companies or large internet scale start-ups
* Understanding of cloud operations, hybrid cloud environments and cloud migration projects at scale, particularly from an operational effectiveness and reliability perspective
* 10+ years of technical engineering experience
* Experience in operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (4) or more of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / Databases / DevOps / Security / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment
* Professional oral and written communication skills, presenting to an audience containing one or more decision maker(s)
* Experience with AWS services and/or other cloud offerings

column1: Public Sector Strategic Engagements Lead, ASEAN, Industry Solution Sales
column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an exceptional business development and sales lead to identify, manage, and execute some of the largest, most complex and high impact opportunities in Public Sector during the solution and pursuit stages. This role is within the Strategic Engagements APJ team and focused on working with our ASEAN account teams on negotiating deals which are unconventional in nature, need a central advocate, and/or require unique investments and commercial frameworks. Responsibilities will include driving C-level customer relationships, developing relationships with key partners and across AWS field sales, ultimately executing joint GTM plans across multiple countries in ASEAN.

This role is a trusted advisor for our customers, both external and internal, including all aspects of business development, deal structuring, support, and closure.

We are interested in connecting with innovators, who are both creative and analytical in approach, but can think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges that our customers face. In order to build and convey compelling value propositions, it is critical that you can demonstrate high level capability as an effective negotiator possessing relevant cloud knowledge.

ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES
As part of the Industry Solutions Sales team, your role will work with the largest Public Sector accounts, establishing and growing key customer relationships (both business and technical). You will be pivotal in helping to define and form repeatable large deal mechanics.

You will be tasked with:
. Support the creation and iteration of repeatable frameworks for entering into strategic partnerships and alliances, establishing AWS as the partner's preferred cloud computing platform.
. Engage the field sales organization, channels, and end customers to create and drive transformation opportunities for AWS.
. Identify, evaluate, negotiate, and manage opportunities across our largest Public Sector customers that represent significant revenue to AWS.
. Manage complex contract negotiations (across Product, Operations, Engineering, Corporate, and senior management) to gain support, approvals, and to execute on the opportunities.
. Develop best practices to foster, manage, and track large strategic opportunities.
. Recommend investments in key strategic offerings and market segments.
. Prepare and give business reviews to AWS and partner senior leaders.

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
The ideal candidate will be committed to solving complex problems, with a hands-on approach and strong bias for action. You will be at your best in a fast-paced setting that is constantly evolving, and will bring to the role:
. Extensive experience with and deep understanding of Global/Large System Integrators.
. Extensive business development and strategic delivery to executive level customers.
. Demonstrated ability to think strategically and creatively, while applying sound business judgment and financial metrics.
. Strong interpersonal, presentation, and writing skills, and the ability to articulate complex concepts and influence others internally and externally.
. Ability to multitask and manage portfolio of cross-functional projects within the program - work prioritization, planning, collaboration, and management.
. Track record of owning and driving results, complex solutions, and programs.
. Ability to effectively lead and collaborate with varied organizations, while navigating the nuances and diversity of the region with sensitivity and an adaptable approach.
. Experience managing diverse, high performance teams in multiple geographies.
. Background in working with the public sector such as Government, Education, and Healthcare.
. Good level of written and spoken English skills.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
. MBA/MS is a plus.
. Knowledge of AWS services and technologies.
. Business acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/disruptive technologies.
. End-to-end negotiation experience, including identifying, developing, and executing successful partnerships including strategic technology relationships.
Basic Qualifications :
The ideal candidate will be committed to solving complex problems, with a hands-on approach and strong bias for action. You will be at your best in a fast-paced setting that is constantly evolving, and will bring to the role:
. Extensive experience with and deep understanding of Global/Large System Integrators or advisory consulting firms

#aws-sgp-pubsec-ap

Job Description :
Job summary
Are you a Windows guru, a SQL Server master or a C# superstar Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and utilize your existing Microsoft technical skills to help customers move to the AWS cloud Do you want to learn the latest cloud computing technologies and play a part in making history Do you like finding innovate ways to solve technical problems and learning how some of the largest enterprises build their architectures

As a Senior Solutions Architect for the Microsoft technology stack you will help customers accelerate their adoption of AWS, and analyzing the technical aspects of building and migrating to AWS. You will also play a key role in working with the AWS Service Teams to help them build the best cloud services on Earth. You will create content and speak publicly about the amazing things that our customers are doing on AWS. Additionally, you will engage with other Solutions Architects and the wider field of technology experts to bring your experience and expertise so they can better support our customers.

Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Technical studies or equivalent related job experience
. 6+ years IT experience that includes at least 4 years of hands-on .NET software development, Windows infrastructure, or SQL database architecture.
. 2+ years of internal or external customer engagement in an architecture role, pre-sales, or consulting.
. Some travel required up to 30% of the time
Preferred Qualifications :
. Strong verbal and written communication skills
. Any AWS certification, preferably associate or professional level, additionally certifications on Azure, MCSA, MCSD, and/or MCSE
. Developing high quality, enterprise scale software products
. Datacenter migration, especially involving Windows Servers and complex Windows workloads
. Designing or managing a large SQL Server implementation
. Designing or managing a large Active Directory implementation
. Knowledge of .NET Programming (C#) and/or life cycle application management (knowledge of CI/CD including common technologies like Azure DevOps, Git and Jenkins)
. Knowledge of cloud services, cloud native design and/or cloud implementation experience
. Knowledge of microservices and application modernization techniques
. Knowledge of Microsoft licensing and common licensing deployments
. Knowledge of infrastructure management platforms like WSUS, SCCM, SCOM
. Knowledge of networking design including DNS, routing, traffic management, firewalls and/or private networking
. Managing highly available data center operations with responsibility for infrastructure robustness, including networking, server hardware and storage application, server, and network security
. Knowledge of the AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation
