column1: Telecom BSS/OSS Business Development Leader, ASEAN
column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Would you like to enable transformations at some of the largest telecom operators in the world Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and the leader in providing secure, reliable, scalable, and innovative cloud services that help businesses across the globe scale and grow. The AWS Telecom Business Development team is looking for a seasoned Telecom industry leader with experience in advising, winning and delivering innovative network transformation solutions for Telecom service providers.

This is a senior role within the Asia-Pacific & Japan (APJ) team, to guide customers in accelerating their digital transformations by building networks that leverage a software-based architecture, and enabling business outcomes leveraging AWS telecom-supportive technologies. You will help our telecom customers accelerate this journey by engaging with the customers business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision AWS services in their environment helping them learn from examples of industry leaders, reference architectures and define what great looks like for their enterprise.

This role may be located in Singapore, Jakarta, Kuala Lumpur or Manila, and will strive to create alignment among customer stakeholders, address resistance to change and provide a tangible, executable vision to transition to a cloud computing model. This leader will operate effectively at multiple levels of the organization and can address concerns across C-suite executives, IT/Network/Procurement leaders and established platform teams.

Areas of expertise will include most of the following:

* In-depth understanding across Telecommunications systems, standards & processes
* Granular understanding of the economics of network operations including BSS/OSS considerations and Telco IT strategy
* Deep familiarity with OSS, Multi-Mediation, Multi-Activation, Service Orchestration, offline and online Billing, Order management and customer experience management domains.
* Firm grasp of Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and various Virtual Network Function (VNF) technologies
* Executive level network transformation proposal structuring, presentation & negotiation, including in consortiums with partners

You will represent the AWS telecom strategy and be the leading voice for AWS telecom-focused solutions. You will leverage worldwide programs, campaigns and work closely with the wider AWS business development, product management, marketing, solutions architecture, partner and professional services teams to position the AWS telecom data strategy for telecom customers and partners.

Responsibilities will include:

* Providing business transformation and digital technology adoption thought leadership to Telecom customers & partners
* Conducting C-level executive workshops engaging and leading strategic discussions with senior telecom industry leaders regarding networks transformation
* Helping Telcos identify transformational opportunities and driving adoption of AWS solutions
* Identifying and scoping high impact transformation solutions with measurable business results for our customers
* Drive lighthouse OSS and BSS transformations leveraging cloud infrastructure and operating principles
* Work with multiple sales and technical teams within AWS and global technology solution providers for OSS and BSS applications to define and execute GTM initiatives.
* Engage each technology solution provider's field sales organizations, channels and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for AWS. Ensure that there is a strategic business development plan for target markets, aligned with AWS strategic direction.
* Inventing and delivering new offers, collaborating with AWS professional services, service teams, partners, and Amazon product teams
* Providing telco thought leadership by participating in industry conferences and executive briefings
* Supporting client engagements within the assigned territory and influencing activities at our Geo Accounts
* Supporting our AWS Partner Network and key industry ISVs with their Telco solutions on AWS

The ideal candidate will possess a foundation of having directly led sales / pre-sales / consulting engagements and interactions at the highest levels of large telecom operators and technology partners. The candidate should have proven expertise at thought leadership, conceptualizing customer-centric solutions, convincing C-Level executives, CIOs/CTOs & line of business leaders and IT architects, and having seen through successful sales to delivery cycles.

Additionally, the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global telecom businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, telecom enterprise applications, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation/shaping, with an awareness of field enablement techniques.
Basic Qualifications :
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
* 15+ years of experience in client related interactions, including executive presentations, relationship management, deal structuring and commercials negotiation, including working with partners in a consortium framework
* Strong understanding of Telco IT and digital transformation, including the role of cloud, data strategy, AI/ML
* Demonstrated ability and track record leading Telco sales growth within a cross-functional team (direct reporting and virtual), in complex client engagements
* Track record of building rapport with senior partner and customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO), building close relationships, and closing large revenue accounts.
* 7+ years experience with $100M+ deals in the Telco sector in sales or business development capacity
* Demonstrated experience designing winning proposals to address the re-architecture of legacy BSS/OSS platforms to be run on public cloud.
Preferred Qualifications :
* Telco industry Business and Technical expertise across IT, OSS/BSS architectures and workloads, including ERP, CRM, Billing, Charging, Order Management, Catalogue Management, Mediation, Provisioning, Activation, Inventory Management, Service Assurance, Fault & Performance Management, Data Warehousing, Decision Support System, EAI/ESB Solutions
* Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or applicable field, or MBA
* Experience creating and executing organizational change management strategies as part of a larger transformation
* Program oversight experience in a Sales / Business Development capacity, including planning, prioritization, successful project completion and maintaining a focus on high standards and quality across own organization and partners
* Experience in evaluating on-premise vs cloud computing models

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an exceptional business development and sales lead to identify, manage, and execute some of the largest, most complex and high impact opportunities in Public Sector during the solution and pursuit stages. This role is within the Strategic Engagements APJ team and focused on working with our ASEAN account teams on negotiating deals which are unconventional in nature, need a central advocate, and/or require unique investments and commercial frameworks. Responsibilities will include driving C-level customer relationships, developing relationships with key partners and across AWS field sales, ultimately executing joint GTM plans across multiple countries in ASEAN.

This role is a trusted advisor for our customers, both external and internal, including all aspects of business development, deal structuring, support, and closure.

We are interested in connecting with innovators, who are both creative and analytical in approach, but can think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges that our customers face. In order to build and convey compelling value propositions, it is critical that you can demonstrate high level capability as an effective negotiator possessing relevant cloud knowledge.

ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES
As part of the Industry Solutions Sales team, your role will work with the largest Public Sector accounts, establishing and growing key customer relationships (both business and technical). You will be pivotal in helping to define and form repeatable large deal mechanics.

You will be tasked with:
. Support the creation and iteration of repeatable frameworks for entering into strategic partnerships and alliances, establishing AWS as the partner's preferred cloud computing platform.
. Engage the field sales organization, channels, and end customers to create and drive transformation opportunities for AWS.

#aws-sgp-pubsec-ap

DESCRIPTION

Are you passionate about building applications with NoSQL databases Do you love helping customers select and use the right data technology for their application requirements Do you want to be part of a team who helps build the future of databases at Amazon Web Services (AWS) Come join us!

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an experienced NoSQL Solutions Architect, who will be the subject matter expert for Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB Compatibility), a fast, scalable, highly available, and fully managed document database service that supports MongoDB workloads. You will get a chance to work with some of the most prominent startups, as well as some of the largest enterprises, to help them architect scalable NoSQL solutions using DocumentDB. You will dive deep into customer challenges and work with AWS service teams to create solutions that solve customer needs.

Roles and responsibilities:
. Be the recognized authority for Amazon DocumentDB subject matter expertise across AWS.
. Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help customers learn about and use Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB Compatibility).
. Provide definitive guidance for customers in choosing the right database services and approaches.
. Be a trusted collaborator for the Amazon DocumentDB service team as the voice of the customer for defining and prioritizing service features.
. Lead enablement by training Solution Architects, Professional Services Consultants, and Technical Account Managers.
. Capture and share best-practice knowledge with customers and the worldwide AWS solution architect community.
. Contribute to the AWS Database Blog, service documentation, and reference architectures.
. Present at industry events to educate customers and evangelize AWS and DocumentDB.
. Open to domestic and international travel up to 35%.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years design and implementation experience with NoSQL technologies such as DocumentDB, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Cassandra, including NoSQL data modeling.
. 3+ years software architecture and development experience using languages such as Java, Python, Go, and Node.js.
. A degree in computer science, software engineering, or mathematics or 10 years equivalent work experience.
. Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
. Demonstrated effectiveness working across multiple business units to achieve results.
. An understanding of cloud computing deployment models as they relate to databases and analytics.
. Working knowledge of modern software development practices such as agile methodologies and DevOps.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Experience communicating effectively across internal and external organizations, for complex mission-critical solutions.
. Deep knowledge of and experience with MongoDB.
. Professional experience influencing and building mind-share convincingly with a varied audience
. Professional experience speaking publicly to large audiences
. Hands-on experience with AWS services related to databases highly desirable, particularly Amazon Aurora, AWS Lambda, Amazon Elasticache, Amazon Elasticsearch, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon S3, Amazon EC2 Container Service, Amazon Kinesis, etc.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column1: Director, AWS PR Asia Pacific & Japan
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) seeks a creative, self-motivated, high-judgment, well-connected, and experienced public relations professional to help drive its communications program across Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ). This includes the ability to lead and manage a team distributed across the region that is responsible for executing strategic, country-specific PR programs and/or targeted, cross-regional thought leadership programs in a way that maximizes positive awareness for Amazon's cloud computing business. The right candidate possesses extensive media relations and social media experience and relationships across APJ, is an exceptional writer and planner, is astutely aware of all issues facing the technology industry, has strong expertise in crisis communications, can exercise high-judgment while acting quickly, as well as the ability to lead strategic, APJ-wide business initiatives.

The Director of AWS APJ PR reports into the International Head of AWS Communications in Luxembourg and partners with the AWS leadership teams across APJ, as well as Amazon PR teams in Seattle, EMEA, LATAM, and Canada. The Director works with AWS leaders to discuss/develop messaging, strategy, and plans and is an integral member of Amazon's worldwide strategic communications team. The ideal candidate is motivated by a highly creative and dynamic culture where the challenge of breaking new ground and redefining best practices is welcome.

In this role, the candidate will have an opportunity to create strategies for delivering news and evangelizing AWS capabilities that are worthy of a company that continues to pioneer the cloud. The successful applicant will lead, motivate, and coach a team to build broad communications campaigns that help to tell the AWS story to a diverse audience including technology leaders and practitioners, business leaders, policy-makers and government officials, and the general public, through the core pillars of innovation, customer and partner success, and economic development and social impact, with the themes of customer obsession, technical leadership, pace of innovation, and breadth of services, which are central to our story. The right candidate is a high-judgement leader who inspires his/her team and works effectively to develop individuals to grow and be the best they can be.

When permitted, this role will require frequent domestic and international travel.

Responsibilities:
. Lead and develop a strong and growing team of in-country and cross-regional PR professionals
. Develop and drive results-oriented communications strategies and impactful PR programs
. Contribute to developing the voice of AWS in APJ
. Drive AWS news/media relations activities and proactive campaigns
. Invent new communication programs and tools that go beyond traditional media relations and align with a dynamic, pioneering cloud business
. Manage issues and look around corners to prevent future topics becoming issues
. Manage proactive business and technology press opportunities
. Align social media activities with marketing and other parts of the AWS business
. Develop and successfully manage relationships with key media and technology and industry influencers
. Act as an APJ expert and counsel for senior leaders in the AWS global business
. Lead PR programs at media events
. Effectively develop and cultivate powerful customer success stories and prepare customers to participate in PR opportunities and AWS events
. Effectively train and prepare executives for PR opportunities
. Drive crisis management programs and serve as a key internal and leadership counselor on communications issues in a way that earns trust with AWS leadership
. Use metrics, data and related insights to help drive programs and activities

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree and minimum of 15 years of public relations experience managing a team
. Demonstrated success working with senior leaders in high-profile situations
. Experience working alongside marketing, social, analyst relations and other functions to deliver integrated campaigns
. Previous experience working within highly matrixed, complex organizational structures
. Technology PR experience required deep technical knowledge advantageous
. Fluent written and verbal English language proficiency required other Asian languages advantageous
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Excellent written and oral communications skills
. Data driven with a passion for measurement
. Comfortable stepping outside of traditional PR to take on strategic business initiatives
. Team player who is willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done
. Experience managing media relations for high-profile technology brands, and a network of media contacts
. Outstanding attention to detail
. Creativity and bias for action

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Do you have Invent and simply mindset and are an Exceptional problem-solver Are you passionate about simplify business problems and developing innovative, scalable ideas through data driven decision making
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in cloud computing and we are looking for a dynamic results-oriented candidate to join as the AWS Asia Partner Strategy, Growth and Insights Team is looking for a Performance & Insights Operations Manager. In this role, you will have an exciting opportunity to shape the strategy and business insights of the AWS Asia Partner organisation with your established operational excellence and collaborative communication skills. You will work closely with the AWS Partner Leadership team to aid them in achieving business objectives. Your operational leadership will enable deep data driven insights that will contribute to the development of our AWS long term strategy and drive impact against our AWS Partner business objectives. Responsibilities include:
Collaborate with AWS Partner leadership team to enable business planning establish business rhythm and cadence, leading meetings through deliverables, outcomes and actions.
Enable for the AWS Partner leadership team tracking and reporting of all key performance indicators against annual, quarterly and monthly goals. Establish and maintain management advance performance and insight dashboards and executive review documents that will drive business outcomes.
Stakeholder management act as a business partner to AWS leadership team and executives, providing insights to help shape the strategy of the business. Act as point of contact and subject matter expert on business escalations.
Sales Lifecycle Performance Insights Opportunity pipeline and sales forecasting analysis working with AWS Partner Leadership team to drive current and accurate performance insights . Business Performance Insights and Analytics expertise and leadership
Collaborate with Business Operations leaders and teams to develop automotive and innovative mechanisms to scale.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 3+ year experience working in Business or Sales Operations
. Undergraduate Degree or equivalent work experience required
. Experience with data insights tools (e.g. www.salesforce.com) and data visualisation (e.g. QuickSight, Tableau)
. Strong Microsoft Excel Skills (e.g. Ability to create pivot tables and charts, develop formulas such as SUMIF, and use vlookup formulas)
. Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Exceptional business acumen and high judgment - be able to use technology/cloud depth and breadth, signals, and data to understand opportunities and challenges, and inform and shape strategic vision and growth initiatives.
. Partnering with others in the organization is key to our long term success and is what helps frame our inclusive culture.
. Invent and simply mindset. Data driven but comfortable with ambiguity. Exceptional problem-solver. Adept at simplifying complexity and developing scalable propositions.
. Strong bias for working backwards from customers. Favors iterative hypothesis/test/analyze/ improve approaches. Pragmatic and is right a lot.
. Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Ability to effectively lead and work with a variety of organizations, management levels, cultures, and personalities.
. Inclusive and Diverse Culture Working with a team that welcomes, celebrates, and leverages a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets to deliver results is exciting. Culturally aware and have good interpersonal skills able to collaborate across different functional teams and internal stakeholders.
. Balanced experience across business strategy/planning, business operations and execution in a multi-billion technology business.

About Us
Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Clicking APPLY NOW or Whatapps +65 88269116
Reg No: R21103775
The Supreme HR Advisory Pte Ltd EA No:14C7279
Job Responsibilities
To provide 1st level of support via hotline calls and emails with SLA
To log all customer requests into the internal ticketing system.
To monitor Linux & Windows systems on AWS and Azure cloud
To provide efficient and timely technical support to end-user.
To escalate any unresolved issue to 2nd and 3rd level engineers for further resolution
To follow up on the progress of all outstanding issues until closure
To perform other IT related duties when assigned by the management
Job Requirements
Diploma in IT with relevant experience
Familiar with Windows OS, Printer Administration, Office 365, Active Directory, O365 Sharepoints, and OneDrive support experience
Basic understanding of DNS, DHCP, and TCP/IP
Must have a strong sense of responsibility, initiative, and commitment to customer service
Experience in Linux/cloud computing will be an advantage
Able to work under shift schedule (work 4 days and rest 3 days)

The global VMware Professional Services Organization influences the success of each VMware implementation. The Professional Services team is dedicated to the success of the customer and their digital strategy. The Professional Services team ensures that VMware customers are successfully implementing their business plans from adoption all the way to a fully functioning solution.
The Senior Consultant is an advanced level technology specialist and subject matter expert, providing customer guidance by facilitating technical workshops, creation of low-level designs and implementation of use cases into high-quality solutions. In addition to customer facing delivery Senior Consultants also provide technical input to pre-sales and drive best practices in the form of white paper creation.
VMware Professional Services is committed to offering a collaborative and supportive working environment with a full enablement plan and the opportunity to develop in the latest Software-Defined Datacenter or Digital Workspace technologies and solutions. We promote an inclusive atmosphere where your voice will be heard, and where you will be part of a dynamic team working in partnership with each other.
We are looking for conscientious and responsible individuals who can build on our successful track record and come with us on the next stage of our journey.
We will sponsor your enablement and certification up to and including VCDX certification.
Work for the global leader in cloud infrastructure and virtualization solutions.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with cross-functional VMware project teams which could consist of VMware pre-sales architects, engineers, product management and support staff.
Work as part of a wider project team or independently act as technical lead on consulting engagements
Confidently gather use case requirements and creation of low-level designs while functioning as an advisory resource for Best Practices and driving adoption of VMware solutions.
Develop use cases into high-quality solutions in your specialist area
Actively demonstrate commercial awareness and stay within the scope of the contracted work.
Take ownership and accountability for individual deliverables.
Define project requirements/issues/constraints with PMs.
Make accurate impact assessments, and raise, implement, close down and roll-back plans when required
Maintain current, high-level technical knowledge of the entire VMware product line and future product direction and expert level knowledge of the core VMware product line and your specialist area
Assist in the development of our consulting service offerings as well as developing white papers and best practices
Must enjoy working with leading edge technology and being an intrinsic part of a fantastic team
As a Cloud Automation subject matter expert, you will be required to gather use case requirements for, and create, test and release high quality vRealize private cloud, VMC on AWS hybrid cloud and TKG container solutions according to Agile or Waterfall methodologies
Understand and articulate the impact of Network Virtualization and Security to a customer's physical IP network, operations and future network and networking security architectures.
Plan and lead virtualized network infrastructure implementations, roll-outs and migrations, including hands-on implementation of NSX for enterprise customers.
Maintain deep technical and business knowledge of cloud computing and networking applications, industry directions, and trends.

Requirements
Demonstrated ability and experience in customer-facing positions as a Professional Services consultant.
Strong documentation and technical writing skills
Adaptable and progressive learner with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to a variety of audiences.
Ability to work independently and work collaboratively in a team environment.
An active listener with excellent and confident communications and interpersonal skills with an ability to read complex customer situations and adapt as needed.
Multiple years of actively delivering IT automation / scripted infrastructure projects ideally based on VMware technologies.
Expertise on VMware Virtual Infrastructure Deployment, Management & Administration: vSphere/vCenter is a strict minimum, vRealize Operations Manager, SRM, vCloud Director, vRealize Automation Center, vRealize Orchestrator
Familiarity with modern IT infrastructure (Server, Storage, Network and IT Security) and hosting operation (Disaster recovery, SLA, Backup, Multi Site, Monitoring, AD & DNS)
Strong experience in development (object-oriented programming, WebService API REST & SOAP), scripting (javascript, Powershell, batch, shell)

Certification and Education
Bachelor's degree as a minimum or demonstrate equivalent experience.
Currently holds the VCP 5.x and / or 6.x certification and ideally holds VMware VCAP/VCIX certifications
Industry certifications from vendors such as AWS, Dell, K8 and Microsoft

Desirable skills and experience
Project governance experience and familiarity with PRINCE2, PMP or TOGAF frameworks
Practical knowledge of the ITIL framework
Experience of presenting at a user group, trade show or similar is highly desirable
Experience with another orchestrator (HP OO, MS SystemCenter Orchestrator, Cisco Tidal Enterprise Orchestrator, BMC Atrium Orchestrator) are considered a plus
Experience in Operation management methods and products are considered a plus as well
Cross Operating System knowledge, getting at least administrator experience in both Linux and Windows world
.net, java or equivalent development language experience.
Knowledge of modern software development methodologies such as DevOps, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Lean.
Experience or good understanding of any of the following cloud management systems: OpenStack, vRealize Automation, vCloud Director (vCD), VMC, Azure, GCP
Solid understanding of REST APIs and datacenter automation.

Why Choose VMware
Make an impact on your career path grow professionally and personally by accessing our in-house learning & development opportunities & education assistance program.
Voice your creative solutions to new and existing problems and watch them become initiatives.
Thrive in a unique work environment where the emphasis reflects our values of Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customers and Community.
Earn a competitive compensation package with performance- based bonuses and increases, a generous benefits package that really takes care of your needs and unexpected perks that make working here fun!


VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

column1: Director, AWS PR Asia Pacific & Japan
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) seeks a creative, self-motivated, high-judgment, well-connected, and experienced public relations professional to help drive its communications program across Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ). This includes the ability to lead and manage a team distributed across the region that is responsible for executing strategic, country-specific PR programs and/or targeted, cross-regional thought leadership programs in a way that maximizes positive awareness for Amazon's cloud computing business. The right candidate possesses extensive media relations and social media experience and relationships across APJ, is an exceptional writer and planner, is astutely aware of all issues facing the technology industry, has strong expertise in crisis communications, can exercise high-judgment while acting quickly, as well as the ability to lead strategic, APJ-wide business initiatives.

The Director of AWS APJ PR reports into the International Head of AWS Communications in Luxembourg and partners with the AWS leadership teams across APJ, as well as Amazon PR teams in Seattle, EMEA, LATAM, and Canada. The Director works with AWS leaders to discuss/develop messaging, strategy, and plans and is an integral member of Amazon's worldwide strategic communications team. The ideal candidate is motivated by a highly creative and dynamic culture where the challenge of breaking new ground and redefining best practices is welcome.

In this role, the candidate will have an opportunity to create strategies for delivering news and evangelizing AWS capabilities that are worthy of a company that continues to pioneer the cloud. The successful applicant will lead, motivate, and coach a team to build broad communications campaigns that help to tell the AWS story to a diverse audience including technology leaders and practitioners, business leaders, policy-makers and government officials, and the general public, through the core pillars of innovation, customer and partner success, and economic development and social impact, with the themes of customer obsession, technical leadership, pace of innovation, and breadth of services, which are central to our story. The right candidate is a high-judgement leader who inspires his/her team and works effectively to develop individuals to grow and be the best they can be.

When permitted, this role will require frequent domestic and international travel.

Responsibilities:
. Lead and develop a strong and growing team of in-country and cross-regional PR professionals
. Develop and drive results-oriented communications strategies and impactful PR programs
. Contribute to developing the voice of AWS in APJ
. Drive AWS news/media relations activities and proactive campaigns
. Invent new communication programs and tools that go beyond traditional media relations and align with a dynamic, pioneering cloud business
. Manage issues and look around corners to prevent future topics becoming issues
. Manage proactive business and technology press opportunities
. Align social media activities with marketing and other parts of the AWS business
. Develop and successfully manage relationships with key media and technology and industry influencers
. Act as an APJ expert and counsel for senior leaders in the AWS global business
. Lead PR programs at media events
. Effectively develop and cultivate powerful customer success stories and prepare customers to participate in PR opportunities and AWS events
. Effectively train and prepare executives for PR opportunities
. Drive crisis management programs and serve as a key internal and leadership counselor on communications issues in a way that earns trust with AWS leadership
. Use metrics, data and related insights to help drive programs and activities

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree and minimum of 15 years of public relations experience managing a team
. Demonstrated success working with senior leaders in high-profile situations
. Experience working alongside marketing, social, analyst relations and other functions to deliver integrated campaigns
. Previous experience working within highly matrixed, complex organizational structures
. Technology PR experience required deep technical knowledge advantageous
. Fluent written and verbal English language proficiency required other Asian languages advantageous
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Excellent written and oral communications skills
. Data driven with a passion for measurement
. Comfortable stepping outside of traditional PR to take on strategic business initiatives
. Team player who is willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done
. Experience managing media relations for high-profile technology brands, and a network of media contacts
. Outstanding attention to detail
. Creativity and bias for action

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Are you passionate about operational excellence, including cost optimisation Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale challenges in the world today Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners that use cloud computing services to run their solutions reliably, securely, efficiently and at lower cost

At AWS Enterprise Support we are looking for a Senior Specialist Technical Account Manager (STAM) to provide unique deep-dive technical engagements for our Enterprise customers across Asia-Pacific, Japan and China (APJC). Based in Singapore (part of the ASEAN team), you will be a member of a dynamic team bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies, focussed on the difficult cost and agility challenges facing many organisations.

You will provide strategic people, process and technology guidance to proactively improve performance, reliability, security and cost-effectiveness of customers solutions using AWS best practices. This role will focus on providing customers with AWS Cloud Operations best practices for Cost Optimisation, Monitoring and Observability, People and Process, Incident Management, Disaster Recover, Continuous Improvement and other DevSecOps topics.

About the team
*Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

*Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

*Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic Qualifications :
* 6+ years of technical engineering experience
* Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience as a technical lead

Preferred Qualifications :
* Software development experience in automation, infrastructure-as-code, tools and dashboards. Experience in a high-level programing language such as Python, Golang or Java
* Internal enterprise experience working with a wide range of internal stakeholders on operations implementation or migration with a company-wide impact.
* Ability to understand complex cloud environments and bridge the gap between technical and business requirements
* Track record of implementing cloud best practices (provisioning, deployment, monitoring using AGILE / Devops methodologies and tools) for enterprise companies or large internet scale start-ups
* Understanding of cloud operations, hybrid cloud environments and cloud migration projects at scale, particularly from an operational effectiveness and reliability perspective
* 10+ years of technical engineering experience
* Experience in operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (4) or more of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / Databases / DevOps / Security / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment
* Professional oral and written communication skills, presenting to an audience containing one or more decision maker(s)
* Experience with AWS services and/or other cloud offerings

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Are you a Windows guru, a SQL Server master or a C# superstar Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and utilize your existing Microsoft technical skills to help customers move to the AWS cloud Do you want to learn the latest cloud computing technologies and play a part in making history Do you like finding innovate ways to solve technical problems and learning how some of the largest enterprises build their architectures

As a Senior Solutions Architect for the Microsoft technology stack you will help customers accelerate their adoption of AWS, and analyzing the technical aspects of building and migrating to AWS. You will also play a key role in working with the AWS Service Teams to help them build the best cloud services on Earth. You will create content and speak publicly about the amazing things that our customers are doing on AWS. Additionally, you will engage with other Solutions Architects and the wider field of technology experts to bring your experience and expertise so they can better support our customers.

Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Technical studies or equivalent related job experience
. 6+ years IT experience that includes at least 4 years of hands-on .NET software development, Windows infrastructure, or SQL database architecture.
. 2+ years of internal or external customer engagement in an architecture role, pre-sales, or consulting.
. Some travel required up to 30% of the time
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Strong verbal and written communication skills
. Any AWS certification, preferably associate or professional level, additionally certifications on Azure, MCSA, MCSD, and/or MCSE
. Developing high quality, enterprise scale software products
. Datacenter migration, especially involving Windows Servers and complex Windows workloads
. Designing or managing a large SQL Server implementation
. Designing or managing a large Active Directory implementation
. Knowledge of .NET Programming (C#) and/or life cycle application management (knowledge of CI/CD including common technologies like Azure DevOps, Git and Jenkins)
. Knowledge of cloud services, cloud native design and/or cloud implementation experience
. Knowledge of microservices and application modernization techniques
. Knowledge of Microsoft licensing and common licensing deployments
. Knowledge of infrastructure management platforms like WSUS, SCCM, SCOM
. Knowledge of networking design including DNS, routing, traffic management, firewalls and/or private networking
. Managing highly available data center operations with responsibility for infrastructure robustness, including networking, server hardware and storage application, server, and network security
. Knowledge of the AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column7:
We have two immediate available positions for Bioinformatics.
You will be part of an established and nationally funded multi-disciplinary and multi-institution research program that focuses on liver cancer (hepatocellular carcinoma, HCC) and other cancers. You will also play a key role in a large-scale international translational and clinical study on HCC that prospectively collect various types of patient biosamples. The program utilizes cutting-edge research technologies and employs radiomics and multi-omics approaches focused on next-generation sequencing (NGS), cfDNA NGS, single cell RNAseq and proteomics, CyTOF, 3D spatial transcriptomics, and targeted/untargeted metabolomics as well as clinical and radiological imaging datasets in the context of a clinical cohort. The candidate will also be expected to establish and work within a sandbox environment.
Your responsibilities will include the following:
- Assist the Principal Investigator in conceptualizing and designing research projects.
- Work collaboratively with scientific and clinical staff on multi-omics and radiomics data processing, statistical analyses, feature extraction for statistical/machine learning and survival analysis, and other relevant computational analyses to better understand the complexity of HCC by using various analytics tools and setting up analysis pipelines.
- Responsible for the coordination and management of the projects in the multidisciplinary study.
The job allows tremendous opportunities for professional growth and development and opportunities to publish in high-impact journals.
Requirements:
- PhD degree in Computational Biology or a quantitative background (e.g. Statistics, Physics, Engineering), or Biomedical-related disciplines with a strong evidence of computational and/or image feature extraction experience.
- Experience with large-scale bioinformatics analysis (including, but not restricted to NGS, single cell sequencing, cfDNA analysis, radiomics analysis, survival analysis and disease modelling).
- Proficient in R (tidyverse, ggplot, bioconductor) or Python (pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn) and good knowledge of Unix shell.
- Knowledge with high performance computing (HPC) and cloud computing (AWS) will be an advantage.
- Experience and knowledge in database management and data architecture will be an advantage.
- Possess excellent analytical, technical and problem-solving skills.
- Well organized and detail oriented.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Able to work with diverse groups of people.
- Good team worker and fast learner.
Candidates with MSc in Computational Biology or related discipline but with significant research experience may be considered.

Are you a seasoned technical program manager ready to support the largest and most complex customers in their journey to the cloud Azure is the fastest growing business in Microsoft's history and is the foundation of Microsoft's commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper-scale, enterprise-grade cloud that has a true hybrid story. The Azure (Networking, Compute, Storage) Team is responsible for accelerating our most strategic customers adoption of Microsoft Azure by connecting our technical experience, along with our customers vision and challenges directly to the engineering product teams, and as a result help to ensure Azure is the most compelling solution on the market. We work across a broad range of Azure technologies understanding customer scenarios, cloud patterns and adoption blockers.

As we drive to be the leading cloud platform in the world, Azure Sovereign Cloud team is hiring an exceptional technical program manager to help support our most complex and challenging customers and engineering programs in the Government landscape. #aznetPM

Success in this role combines managing customer engagements, listening to and understanding customer use cases and scenarios, translating these into viable cloud network services and communicating this at an executive level. Responsibilities include program management of technical delivery teams on proof-of-concept implementations, as well as architecture design and review in a cloud-scale, cloud-pace environment. Close collaboration with generalists and specialists in the Microsoft field and delivery teams, peer teams within Microsoft Engineering and diverse customer teams is critical. The role is also responsible for communications related to our programs of work, including executive reporting and reviews with both customer and Microsoft stakeholders.
This position is located in Singapore and some travel will be required (0%-25%).
The successful candidate will have experience in cloud-scale network infrastructure projects, as well as direct customer engagement and be able to take a collaborative approach to solving problems. They will fit comfortably into an ambitious and challenging environment and have strong verbal and written communication skills. They will be objective, self-disciplined and possess excellent business and technical judgement, and be able to operate autonomously. A critical part of the role is the ability to conceptualize complex ideas quickly and convey those thoughts to others in a clear, effective, and motivating manner. Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
To contribute as a key member of the team, the successful candidate must be eager to take on and lead initiatives, be an open communicator, have a commitment to excellence and possess a strong sense of personal commitment in accomplishing both customer and Microsoft goals.

additional details:

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

We are currently looking for an Azure Specialist for our Singapore Public Sector segment to drive our next generation of Cloud projects and increase our Cloud consumaption share in market.

As an Azure Infrastructure Specialist, you are a senior business leader with deep technical and business expertise within our enterprise sales organization, working with our most important customers. You will lead a virtual team of sales, technical, and services resources to help customers realize the digital transformation through cloud computing. A core competency of the role is to advance the engagement process to achieve/exceed quarterly Azure Infrastructure consumption targets for related workloads in your assigned accounts. You possess a high EQ with executive presence, able to engage with senior decision makers to uncover digital transformation initiatives, and a passion for learning how Azure cloud services can deliver digital transformation. You will develop and maintain an Azure Infrastructure migration and modernization expertise, able to identify projects, build a compelling business case, and drive the consumption project to production. You will build and maintain relationships with customers, influence long-term strategic direction and act as a trusted advisor driving engagement at the CXO level with business and technology decision makers. You will help customers evaluate their cloud strategy, determine approaches to application and data migration and modernization, and recommend solutions that meet their requirements. You will remove roadblocks to deployment and drive customer satisfaction

Job Description :
Job summary
Are you a Windows guru, a SQL Server master or a C# superstar Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and utilize your existing Microsoft technical skills to help customers move to the AWS cloud Do you want to learn the latest cloud computing technologies and play a part in making history Do you like finding innovate ways to solve technical problems and learning how some of the largest enterprises build their architectures

As a Senior Solutions Architect for the Microsoft technology stack you will help customers accelerate their adoption of AWS, and analyzing the technical aspects of building and migrating to AWS. You will also play a key role in working with the AWS Service Teams to help them build the best cloud services on Earth. You will create content and speak publicly about the amazing things that our customers are doing on AWS. Additionally, you will engage with other Solutions Architects and the wider field of technology experts to bring your experience and expertise so they can better support our customers.

Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Technical studies or equivalent related job experience
. 6+ years IT experience that includes at least 4 years of hands-on .NET software development, Windows infrastructure, or SQL database architecture.
. 2+ years of internal or external customer engagement in an architecture role, pre-sales, or consulting.
. Some travel required up to 30% of the time
Preferred Qualifications :
. Strong verbal and written communication skills
. Any AWS certification, preferably associate or professional level, additionally certifications on Azure, MCSA, MCSD, and/or MCSE
. Developing high quality, enterprise scale software products
. Datacenter migration, especially involving Windows Servers and complex Windows workloads
. Designing or managing a large SQL Server implementation
. Designing or managing a large Active Directory implementation
. Knowledge of .NET Programming (C#) and/or life cycle application management (knowledge of CI/CD including common technologies like Azure DevOps, Git and Jenkins)
. Knowledge of cloud services, cloud native design and/or cloud implementation experience
. Knowledge of microservices and application modernization techniques
. Knowledge of Microsoft licensing and common licensing deployments
. Knowledge of infrastructure management platforms like WSUS, SCCM, SCOM
. Knowledge of networking design including DNS, routing, traffic management, firewalls and/or private networking
. Managing highly available data center operations with responsibility for infrastructure robustness, including networking, server hardware and storage application, server, and network security
. Knowledge of the AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.

column6: Oem  Supplier Relations  purchase contracts  oem contracts  Commercial Acumen  Procure-to-Pay  Cross Functional Relationships  Financial Modeling  Managing suppliers  Excellent Interpersonal Communication Skills  technology services
column7:
About Us
At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.
We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!
About the department
We are looking for a sourcing specialist to manage the contracts and spend with our infrastructure services and software suppliers. You will be part of the Hardware Sourcing Partnership team who is responsible for developing business and technology roadmap with the support from our global supplier network to meet Cloudflare's infrastructure goals. Technologies will be centered on Cloud computing, data center services, OEM and ODM hardware. You will be the guru towards how technology products and services are operated by suppliers and contracted through different agreements.
What you'll do
Support the end-to-end Source to Pay process across data center services, Cloud computing and hardware categories of purchases
Own contract renewal strategy of existing suppliers, and execute accordingly before deadline
Validate supplier invoices, resolve any disputes, and ensure payments are on time
Perform the development of pricing models and detailed market analysis to support tender processes and negotiations with suppliers
Build strong relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and drive positive commercial outcomes for the company
Lead the preparation of materials to assist with future budgeting and cost management of infrastructure suppliers
Coordinate contracting process of the outgoing and inbound agreements in Hardware Sourcing team from end to end
Measure, manage and improve supplier performance against agreed service level agreements (SLA).
Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
Experience with contract lifecycle management and procure-to-pay processes
Experience working with Technology service, software, OEM and ODM suppliers
Understand contracts and demonstrate a strong commercial acumen
Have financial modeling experience and know how to conduct cost evaluation
Familiar with different sourcing tools, such as RF-x
With a can-do attitude, able to execute on ideas both independently and through collaboration with others
Intellectual curiosity, particularly around technology
Excellent communication skills; ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Highly organized and able to juggle many tasks without losing sight of the highest priority items
Perform well in a global team environment
Preferred qualifications
3+ years of Sourcing and Supplier relationship management experience
What Makes Cloudflare Special
We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.
Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.
Athenian Project: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.
Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.
1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.
Sound like something you'd like to be a part of We'd love to hear from you!
This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.
Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.
Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at [HIDDEN TEXT] or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

Job Purpose:
We are looking for a Development Manager who can design and build best-in-class data applications and provide technical leadership to the local CMAD development teams. You will work closely with product owners, project managers, developers, data scientists and other team members to deliver solutions through new and existing channels. You will need to be confident to work with senior business stakeholders to understand their requirements and to ideate and drive the development of innovative technology solutions in a timely manner. As well as being a leader, you should offer hands on coding skills and will provide technical and architecture guidance via design, coding, deployment of the solutions.
Job Background/context:
We believe the future is here with us! Home to where we define, ideate, develop and distribute production-ready financial solutions of far-reaching impact. And right now, the door's open to direct the future of our technology for a truly global client base. This means collaborating with the keenest minds in data science, big data, software engineering, web development, UX design and more. Doers looking to bring the next bold ideas to life for a fascinating array of clients - investing, trading and transacting at the forefront of change in markets and economies the world over.
If you have this kind of vision, are capable of seeing ahead, of developing a clear path forward in a quest to try the as yet untried, here is the opportunity. In return we offer a supported, resource-rich, vibrant co-working environment, part of an ecosystem of globally interconnected labs, realizing a broader mission of enabling growth and economic progress on a scale you won't find anywhere else. Welcome to APAC Cross Markets Analytics & Digitization (CMAD)!
Required Skills and Experience:
This role is for a Development Manager requiring a variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
Needed: Deep and broad experience in application development (Python) and technical architecture. You should proactively look to develop and implement best practices across the entire project team, practicing continuous process improvement.
Needed: Strong Python coding skills with some experience in data science projects. Experience with Airflow orchestration is needed.
Needed: Experience with managing a team of developers and driving their work on standardized best practice. Your own experiences should reflect that you have done this in an environment where the need is to deliver impactful business solutions in short periods of time. You should be able to guide team members toward best solutions for the problem at hand and listen, interact and train developers to enhance their skill sets.
Needed: Experience with Dev ops/ CI/ CD tools & process (some of GIT/Bitbucket, Maven, Ant, Jenkins, Sonar), Testing tools & frameworks (some of Jasmin/Karma, JUnit, Selenium, Cucumber, Mockito).
Needed: Some experiences with Big Data technologies and Cloud Computing including AWS or Google Cloud Platform. An interest in driving the CMAD cloud strategy going forward.
Great to Have: Experience of optimizing data infrastructure with hands on experience of SQL and Oracle and ideally other database technologies including MongoDB and PostgreSQL. Experience with cloud native tools.
Great to Have: Experiences with BI tools like Tableau and how to achieve data optimization for Tableau Dashboards.
Great to Have: Agile Methodology and Tools (JIRA) Experience with MicroServices & Event Architecture is big plus Experience with Integration patterns and messaging technologies (JMS, Mule, Kafka, RabbitMQ) Experience with Caching solutions such as Hazlecast, Gemfire, EHCache. Experience with Cloud Platforms, Container/Orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry)
Good to Have: Experience with Java eco-system and associated tooling (Core & EE, Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Cloud), UI/UX (React JS, Angular or equivalent), Web Technologies (JavaScript, HTML 5, CSS, JSON, REST, SOAP).

Job Description :
Job summary
Are you interested in working with the large enterprise organizations as they navigate through some of the most dynamic and disruptive transformation projects in their organization's history Does the prospect of empowering these organizations cloud transformation success by aligning professional services to critical business and IT outcomes, overseeing and assessing engagement delivery, driving a holistic partner strategy and providing insight to accelerate rate of execution/adoption of cloud technology excite you

The Amazon Web Services Professional Services team is looking for Enterprise Service Manager (ESM) that can manage the working relationship with large organizations, develop a long term Professional Services strategy and execute that strategy within those accounts. The ESM is a trusted advisor for our largest and most committed customers. The role includes all aspects of Business and Digital transformation consulting, business development, relationship development, sales of Professional Services, delivery oversight, and program management in those accounts.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about: - Building long term engagement with large, complex, and distributed Public Sector organizations
. Engage with customers to understand their business drivers and align with AWS technology and execution through AWS professional services and partners.
. Development of long term Cloud, Digital, and Business Transformation strategy for customers
. Identify & develop specific transformation opportunities and create supporting business & financial cases supporting the case for change
. Deal shaping, including staffing estimations, deal pricing, and proposal development
. SOW development, contract negotiations & deal closure
. Leading Innovation Accelerator workshops with customers, designing and running digital experiments, and scaling through professional services
. Overseeing delivery of projects in nominated accounts, ensuring high quality delivery and alignment to the business case value
. Steering Committee leadership supporting customer CxO's, communicating business value, program schedule, and owning mitigation of delivery risks & issues
. Act as single person of contact for customer executives, developing deep, and trustful relations
. Educate customers on AWS services and translate those into a clear business value proposition

About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic Qualifications :
. 10+ years of product management, product marketing, and/or strategic management consulting experience in an enterprise technology company, demonstrating experience with go-to-market strategy development and execution
. Experience in public cloud computing or with a major enterprise software or infrastructure provider
. Practical experience using the AWS platform for rapid application development and scaling
. Demonstrated industry leadership in the areas of lean enterprise, digital innovation, digital strategy and/or product development
. Experience in leading engagements in one or more of the following: Lean Startup / Enterprise Methodology, User Experience, Product Management, Behavioral Science
. Able to work in a diverse team
Preferred Qualifications :
. Enterprise Architecture Frameworks (e.g. TOGAF, Zachman) and identifying the relationships between business services, information, applications and global infrastructure assets
. Hands on experience leading large-scale digital or lean transformation projects
. Broad enterprise systems technology experience including IaaS / virtualization technologies, SAP, Oracle, and custom applications
. Familiarity with industry compliance and security standards including PCI DSS, SOC-1&2, and ISO 27001.

You will work closely with product owners, project managers, developers, data scientists and other team members to deliver solutions through new and existing channels. You will need to be confident to work with senior business stakeholders to understand their requirements and to ideate and drive the development of innovative technology solutions in a timely manner.
Job Background/context:
We believe the future is here with us! Home to where we define, ideate, develop and distribute production-ready financial solutions of far-reaching impact. And right now, the door is open to help develop the future of our technology for a truly global client base. This means collaborating with the keenest minds in data science, big data, software engineering, web development, UX design and more.
