DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Would you like to make the world more sustainable through technology Would you like to help our customers innovate and deliver breakthrough solutions for their end customers and businesses that align to sustainability agendas and goals Would you like to pioneer the use of cloud services to help drive innovation to achieve sustainability goals Would you like to be part of building a fast-growing program to worldwide scale

As the APJ Digital Sustainability Lead, you will have an exciting opportunity to lead customer engagements and work with our area Digital Innovation specialists, APJ & WW leadership & local AWS teams. You will work closely with selected customers - engaging line of business and C-suite leaders, understanding their opportunities & challenges, leading sustainability engagements utilizing Amazon mechanisms & best practices and helping customers understand the changing landscape and the need for innovation through to prototypes and scaled solutions leveraging technology. Your responsibilities include partnering with customers to work backwards from their customer needs, expectations and goals and to identify and prioritize solutions and/or develop new innovative solutions while positioning AWS sustainability values. Your work will influence APJ go-to-market approaches, thought leadership and innovation offerings.

You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial enterprise technology sales environment, and working with cross-functional teams as many parts of the program will have interdependencies with other teams within AWS. Typically cross-functional collaboration includes sales teams, sales leadership, solutions architects, marketing, partners, professional services, and sales enablement.

The right candidate will have experience delivering Sustainability agendas & initiatives for/at enterprise customers. This includes demonstrated experience in understanding sustainable goals and building business and customer initiatives to support these. The right candidate has a proven track record of leading and driving multiple simultaneous projects to meet customer business objectives, excellent project management skills, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data and metrics bias, a good understanding of cloud solutions, and a passion for helping customers transform using cloud technologies.

*This position can be located in either Singapore or Australia (Sydney or Melbourne).

Key job responsibilities
. Working backwards to understand customers challenges and opportunities, and partner to identify and prioritize solutions (or develop net new solutions), while positioning AWS value proposition(s) for sustainability initiatives.
. Deliver engagements that assist customers to define sustainable innovative product ideas to address customers expectations and competitive gaps
. Develop corresponding commercial proposals, bringing together the relevant teams including functional, legal, compliance, and business.
. Work closely with AWS technical teams, partners and customer teams to develop and deploy prototypes and scaled solutions, in line with customer's sustainability goals
. Represent and build AWS best-practices around sustainability, innovation, product management, software engineering, data and analytics, and other platform capabilities to work
. Collaborate with the Global Sustainability Team to develop the AWS Sustainability POV
. Develop C-suite and line-of-business relationships within customer organization within the Sustainability industry
. Build a Sustainability practice and offering that is scalable across customers in APJ
. Develop and define key metrics to monitor sustainability performance across the program/product lifecycle. Professionally communicate and present to key decision makers and senior leaders of the business via QBRs, Flash updates, key metric reports
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree with 10+ years of experience in consulting, solutions development, product management, and/or transformation roles with a sustainability capacity
. Industry experience in Sustainability Example: energy/water management, renewable energy, supply-chain (GHG emission tracking and analysis, packaging, transportation)
Experience with green energy and solar projects, smart sensor / green technologies
. An understanding of green transportation, electric vehicle infrastructure and logistics
. Knowledge in high volume industrial operations
. Excellent stakeholder engagement and change management experience
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. MBA or equivalent post-graduate qualifications
. A strong understanding of the 17 United Nations sustainable development goals and IPCC studies, and how they apply to customers in different industries
. Experience working with Enterprise organizations to develop sustainability goals, agendas and programs
. Excellent business and financial acumen and negotiations skills, with ability to influence senior stakeholders
. Technical acumen and understanding of emerging disruptive technologies, like cloud computing, IoT, Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, AR/VR etc
. Passion for the targeted industry sectors - good understanding of how sustainability initiatives operate and the unique characteristics of the industry ecosystems
. Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills. Experience communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple teams
. Passion for cloud technologies - deep understanding of public and hybrid cloud platforms
. Technical knowledge of applications, platforms, and data ecosystem, with ability to go deep on technical aspects to understand current and future customer needs and present AWS technical benefits

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS Cloud enables customers of all s and industries to run their applications on Amazon's cloud computing infrastructure, and to drive innovation which helps transform their businesses. The SMB APJ segment team is one of the most exciting, fast moving and diverse customer segments within AWS. Our role is to develop programs and drive initiatives across Sales, Partner and Marketing to support the growth objectives of our Small-Medium Business (SMB) customer segment across APJ.

The AWS Program Management team defines, builds, launches, and delivers the programs our global customers use every day. We are looking for a leader with experience in program strategy and roadmap development and prioritization and getting things done. S/he should be a self-starter that thrives in ambiguity, with the ability to influence multi-functionally, and the willingness to roll up sleeves to operate in a dynamic environment. The ideal candidate is someone with a demonstrated history of successfully owning and managing large, complex problems and engaging with cross-functional teams, and numerous stakeholders up to senior levels, directly and through influence.

As a Strategic Initiatives Program Manager for SMB, you'll be expected to focus on envisioning, experimenting, creating and operationalizing programs that will impact the APJ SMB customers at scale. You'll be responsible for anticipating bottlenecks, making tradeoffs, and welcoming an acceptable level of risk to maximize business benefit. You will own the execution and program management of strategic initiatives by collaborating with cross-functional work stream owners and reporting progress, updates, challenges, and solutions to leaders.

If you enjoy creating and managing programs that will have big impact on an organization, this is the role for you.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 10+ years of program management, business development, consulting or client facing experience
. Experience effectively managing, influencing, negotiating, and communicating with business partners and internal teams on program performance.
. Experience engaging with C-Level executives, senior executives, and working across internal and external organization
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Experience in building strategic processes at a global level.
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insights
. Global experience with program launches in multiple geographies simultaneously.
. Track record of taking ownership and driving results
. Understanding of the cloud ecosystem and experience in working with the small and medium business customers.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must.

Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon's Legal Department is looking for a talented technology lawyer in Singapore to fill the position of Senior Corporate Counsel to support Amazon Web Services (AWS), a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon.com. AWS is at the forefront of the cloud computing and service industry, providing IT services such as on-demand compute capacity, storage, content delivery, databases, IOT, AI/ML services, and more.

This Senior Corporate Counsel will lead the legal team that supports AWS's Commercial Sales, Marketing and Business Development activities across South-East Asia. This Senior Corporate Counsel will negotiate enterprise and technology licensing agreements and other high value agreements with customers and partners ranging from startups to large multinationals. This Senior Corporate Counsel will also advise on marketing and business development initiatives, global expansion, regulatory issues, pre-litigation legal disputes and inquiries, and other matters that arise for AWS's business in South-East Asia.

In this role, you will have primary drafting and negotiation responsibilities on deals, and provide day-to-day advice for senior executives and other leaders. The successful candidate will be proactive, entrepreneurial, enjoy being challenged, have strong written and oral communication skills, and demonstrate sound, pragmatic judgment in ambiguous situations. Compensation will be based on experience and includes equity compensation.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
Basic Qualifications :
. Law degree (LLB, JD or equivalent) from a leading law school.
. Qualified to practice law in Singapore, Australia, US, UK or other common law jurisdiction.
. 10+ years of legal experience.
. Strong transactional experience.

Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience at a leading law firm.
. Experience at a technology company.
. Familiar with IT infrastructure, outsourcing, telecommunications or cloud computing contracts.
. Familiar with privacy and data protection laws.
. Management experience.

Job Descriptions:
As part of a high performing team, You will be heading the department to spearhead the development of the Company's direction to enhance our current technology to gear towards integration of security elements into cloud computing, AI, VA and etc to ensure the smooth delivery of quality services to meet the client and company requirements and to help the Company realise the value they can gain from their IT investments supporting strategy and being a key growth driver.
You will also manage the daily operations of the IT systems to ensure smooth and efficient user operations. As part of the systems development process, you will manage IT systems integrators and oversee contract software vendors in assisting the Company's project deliverance to Clients.
You are also required to understand the IT management policy, quality management policy as well as security policy and standards to ensure that the development processes, procedures and systems are designed in compliance to these policies and standards as well as to demonstrate in-depth technical/functional capabilities and professional knowledge.
Demonstrate ability to assimilate new knowledge so as to support the company's systems. You will be required to manage product testing, documentation and knowledge transfer to Sales, Operations and Quality departments.
You will also interface with vendors to ensure technical compatibility and business sustainability on infrastructure and application systems integration.
You will also be responsible to ensure timely resolution of systems problems to ensure optimal IT performance at all times.
You will also be playing a key role in designing systems based on cloud native practice, leading and implementing innovative software solutions.
To provide constructive on-the-job feedback/coaching to team members. Foster an innovative and inclusive team-oriented work environment. Play an active role in counselling and mentoring junior members within the organization.
Job Requirements:
Diploma/Degree in Electrical, Electronics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related disciplines
At least 5 years of experience in full-stack software development, vendor management as well as systems support / maintenance
Strong knowledge of Cloud Native principles and techniques such as Microservices-based architecture and RESTful API development and container-based software deployment.
Hands on experience with Cloud platforms such as Aliyun, AWS, Microsoft Azure, Openstack or Google Cloud Platform. Having experience working on MTCS level 3 providers are an added advantage.
Familiar with mobile development in iOS or Android will be a plus
Familiar with different programming languages (eg. Java, C/C++, NET, Python, Javascript, etc.) proficiency in Java will be a plus
Familiar with Front-end programming language such as Javascript/CSS3/HTML5
A team player with strong communication skills and hands-on technical experience
Possess critical thinking skills and excellent communication skills
What we look for:
Highly motivated individual with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry.
An effective communicator, you will be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
Other Information:
Location: Ubi
Working hours: 9 am to 6 pm (Alternate Saturday)
Salary (commensurate with experience): Basic salary + OT allowances + Transport Allowance + Ranking Reward + Variable Bonus & allowances + Attendance Incentive & etc
Resumes please include:
Personal Particulars;
Education background;
Working experience;
Current and Expected Salary
Date of Availibity/Notice Period
Interested applicants are invited to send your updated resume via Apply Now for a confidential discussion. We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Description
Our Design & Engineering Team is at the forefront of our company's product development. As the Backend Software Engineer, you will be responsible for the design and development of reusable back-end applications and infrastructure (NodeJS, RabbitMQ, Linux servers, video streaming servers, NoSQL databases) for a dozen front-end applications and 3rd party developers who build drone apps. You will also model data and objects, improve system reliability, secure critical information flow, and manage configuration changes. You will be working closely with front-end app developers and DevOps in the Software Engineering Team.
Our ideal candidate is someone with demonstrated technical capabilities, is able to excel in a dynamic work environment, and is passionate about advancing drone technology.

Develop new application logic and build scalable microservices
Translate business requirements into high quality and maintainable code
Write code that meets internal standards for style, maintainability and best practices
Communicate and design microservices that communicate across HTTP and Websocket interfaces
Write clean and maintainable code that is properly tested and reviewed

Passionate about solving challenging problems and applications that empowers others

Job Description :
Role is based in Singapore, covering APJ with some regional responsibilities. This role specifically is to work with the Venture Capitalists, Incubators and Accelerators across APJ.

Do you like startups Are you interested in cloud computing Yes We have a role you might find interesting.

Startups are the large enterprises of the future. These young companies are founded by ambitious people who have a desire to build something meaningful and to challenge the status quo. To address underserved customers, or to challenge incumbents. They usually operate in an environment of scarcity: whether that's capital, engineering resource, or experience. This is where you come in.

The AWS Startup Solutions Architecture team is dedicated to working with these early stage startup companies as they build their businesses. We're here to make sure that they can deploy the best, most scalable, and most secure architectures possible - and that they spend as little time and money as possible doing so.

We are looking for technical builders who love the idea of working with early stage startups to help them as they grow. In this role, you'll work directly with a variety of interesting customers and help them make the best (and sometimes the most pragmatic) technical decisions along the way. You'll have a chance to build enduring relationships with these companies and establish yourself as a trusted advisor.

As well as spending time working directly with customers, you'll also get plenty of time to sharpen the saw and keep your skills fresh. We have more than 175 services across a range of different categories and it's important that we can help startups take advantages of the right ones. You'll also play an important role as an advocate with our product teams to make sure we are building the right products for the startups you work with. And for the customers you don't get to work with on a 1:1 basis you'll get the chance to share your knowledge more broadly by working on technical content and presenting at events.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Do you like startups Are you interested in cloud computing Yes We have a role you might find interesting.

Startups are the large enterprises of the future. These young companies are founded by ambitious people who have a desire to build something meaningful and to challenge the status quo. To address underserved customers, or to challenge incumbents. They usually operate in an environment of scarcity: whether that's capital, engineering resource, or experience. This is where you come in.

The AWS Startup Solutions Architecture team is dedicated to working with these early stage startup companies as they build their businesses. We're here to make sure that they can deploy the best, most scalable, and most secure architectures possible - and that they spend as little time and money as possible doing so.

We are looking for technical builders who love the idea of working with early stage startups to help them as they grow. In this role, you'll work directly with a variety of interesting customers and help them make the best (and sometimes the most pragmatic) technical decisions along the way. You'll have a chance to build enduring relationships with these companies and establish yourself as a trusted advisor.

As well as spending time working directly with customers, you'll also get plenty of time to sharpen the saw and keep your skills fresh. We have more than 175 services across a range of different categories and it's important that we can help startups take advantages of the right ones. You'll also play an important role as an advocate with our product teams to make sure we are building the right products for the startups you work with. And for the customers you don't get to work with on a 1:1 basis you'll get the chance to share your knowledge more broadly by working on technical content and presenting at events.

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities

Basic Qualifications :
. 8+ years of experience architecting, building, or operating cloud-based applications or infrastructures
. Technical degree required Computer Science or Math background desired
. 2+ years relevant experience in technology/software sales or pre-sales consulting

Preferred Qualifications :
Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
. Experience in the startup community as either a founder, mentor, investor, or early technical employee
. Experience architecting/operating solutions build on AWS
. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers
. Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations
. Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
. Experience with AI/ML technologies/solutions
. Experience with migrating workloads onto the cloud

column7:
Responsibilities:
- Manage and oversee the security operation of PA/APAC.
- Develop and design, and lead the cyber security strategies, implement security procedures and standards
- Supervise security teams, Manage the enterprise's information security organization, consisting of direct reports and indirect reports under PA/APAC teams. Comprehend enterprise information security and IT risk management program to ensure that the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information
- Manage and support related threat intelligence and investigation of identified potential indicators of compromise (IOCs)
- Create, communicate and implement a risk-based process for IT risk management, including the assessment and treatment for risks that may result from internal, external partners, consultants and other service providers. Work directly with the business units to facilitate IT risk assessment and risk management processes, and work with stakeholders throughout the enterprise on identifying acceptable levels of Information Security management.
- Develop and manage information security budgets, planning, training, testing, executing and monitoring them for variances.
- Leading initiatives to assess the adequacy and effectiveness of IT controls and policies, ensuring that business users are compliant to the IS standards (ISO 27001, PDPA and etc).
- Responsible for information security operation and information security incident investigations, and propose corrective and preventive measures.
- Work with Security Operation Centre (SOC) members on the incidents reported to verify the security events status
- Overseeing computer networks monitoring for security issues and monthly security event monitoring including logging, reporting
- Create and manage information security and risk management awareness training programs for all employees, contractors and approved system users.
- Consult with IR for capability and countermeasure enhancements
- Provides advisory in security tool lifecycles and road maps
- Oversee and ensure compliance to security standards and recommend security implementations
- Manage a framework for roles and responsibilities with regard to information ownership, classification, accountability and protection. Enhance the framework based on the company IS and Security Policy.
- Provide strategic risk guidance for IT project, including the evaluation and recommendation of technical control, security measurements, liaise with enterprise architecture and project teams.
REQUIREMENTS:
Qualifications:
- Bachelor Degree in Information Systems or related field
- At least 5-10 years of relevant experience in IS security and IT security tools
- Experience in leading IT security workforce team handling security ops and IT security related issues
- Experience familiarity in using cyber security and SIEM tools
- Understanding of common cyber attack techniques and methods, common types of malware, network protocols, OSI layers, OS internals (primarily Windows, but Linux & macOS is a plus)
- Strong knowledge on Public Cloud Security (AWS, Azure, GCB)
- Knowledge on cyber security and endpoint technologies, including AV, EDR, DLP, CASB, PAM, IAM, Cloud security
- Endpoints: Familiar with Windows, Linux, MacOS and mobile devices
- Cloud Security: Good understanding of cloud computing security on Microsoft M365, Azure, AWS
- Candidates with exposure to Governance, risk management, and compliance (GRC) will be of added advantage
- Proven track record on managing external vendors / Managed Services
- Business management skill and able in engaging with C-level business stakeholder is an added advantage
- Flexibility and abilities to learn new thing/skills fast
- Team player, team's mentor
- Good communication and presentation skills
- Experience in customer service level

column1: Partner Development Manager - Global Systems Integrators
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for world class candidates to lead and manage our partnerships with the leading global systems integrators. Do you have the business savvy and industry expertise necessary to position Amazon as the technology platform of the future You will work directly with partners to drive exponential growth through the development of their practice areas, skill sets, go-to-market with AWS.
Your responsibilities as Partner Development Manager, GSI within our APAC business relationship is to build executive and field relationships with an AWS Premier Global System Integrator on the cusp of incredible growth in the APAC region. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with this partner, you will be responsible for driving top line revenue growth, capability development, major strategic agreements, and overall end customer adoption across all market segments. The ideal candidate will possess the business background that enables them to engage at the CXO level, the channel experience to understand the needs and capabilities of their partner, and the sales background needed to easily interact with customers and sales/field reps. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

Key job responsibilities
. Work with AWS APAC & Global sales managers and your partner to define and execute joint sales and go to market programs.
. Manage and drive joint sales engagements between the partner and AWS sales teams
. Serve as a key member of the business development team in helping to define and deliver the joint solution set and supporting collateral for industry and service campaigns.
. Engage the partner's field sales organization, channels, and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for AWS.
. Set a strategic business development plan for target market segments and ensure it is in-line with the AWS strategic direction.
. Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using AWS.
. Work closely with the partner's customer base to ensure they are successful using our web services, making sure they have the technical resources required.
. Ensure that AWS is the partner's preferred cloud computing platform across all product lines.
. Understand the technical and capability requirements of our partners and work closely with internal training and certification teams to equip the partner to deliver outcomes on AWS for their clients.
. Operational Excellence, the ability to identify the key data to manage the Alliance, prepare and present business reviews to senior executive management teams both at the partner and AWS.

About the team
Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 7+ years of sales, business development and/or partner management experience
. Previous experience working for, or working closely with, a global system integrator
. Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
. Proven experience driving revenue through partners with structured programs

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics
. Strong presentation, written and operational skills coupled with the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
. Experience working within the cloud category is highly desired
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
. Master's Degree in business or related field
. Visible IT industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT infrastructure, professional services, outsourcing, and cloud adoption
. Experience building workforce capabilities in/with large system integrators
. Broad based technology experience including cloud computing, data, AI/ML, networking, security, storage and ongoing infrastructure management
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

column1: APJ Cloud Sales Centre (CSC) Strategy & Operations Manager
column7:
DESCRIPTION

In this role, you will demonstrate strong bias for action, but also must have the ability to Dive Deep (see Amazon Leadership Principles). You will drive the management cadence, administration and execution of the team's goals, measurement of goal attainment, evolving and driving various sales processes, involving alignment with the customer sales team and proposing improvements to the business to increase its effectiveness in driving desired results.

The successful candidate must be able to roll-up their sleeves, work in a fast-paced start-up organization, and operate with significant autonomy and discretion.

The ideal candidate will possess a keen business sense and exceptional analytical skills, is able to articulate and communicate a clear value proposition across customers, partners, and within the AWS organization, and its comfortable working across internal functions and geographies. The candidate will be naturally curious, going beyond the obvious to discover unexpected insights and translate those into tangible business value, demonstrating Customer Obsession. Want to know more about what it's like to be part of our Team at AWS Hear from our builders: AWS Builder Stories

. At least 10+ years experience working in Sales operations, Business operations areas directly engaging with sales force
. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
. Proven experience with the development and implementation of systems/tool utilized for SFDC, variable compensation, revenue reporting, forecasting etc
. Expert level in Excel and Data query tools and Strong business-process design experience

. Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial
. Experience working with Cloud Computing

CLIENT SUMMARY

Our client, a Singapore based Service Provider is putting together an elite new team to serve their SMB and enterprise customers around cutting-age technology like Cloud, Cybersecurity, AI, 5G and IOT.
Not only will you enjoy working in a dynamic and fast-moving environment collaborating with the telco team, you can also be part of the cohort to deliver more value than the competition.
Their mission is to transform people's lives by creating a connected world that is seamless, smart and safe, while innovating the way telcos operate. As one of the fastest growing digital telco operators in the Asia-Pacific they have operations in Singapore, Australia and New Zealand with a defining difference the world's first telco powered by a proprietary cloud platform and pioneering a disruptive operating model with unparalleled efficiency and customer focus.
Company Culture

This is an exciting opportunity to create and grow in a rapidly growing organisation that is a disruptor in the Telecommunication space.
You will work with amazing colleagues and within a culture that encourages you to do your best at work while staying authentic and true to yourself.
A work culture that puts your individual needs at the core: Remote, Hybrid or In-Office choose a work rhythm that suits you and your team.
Our client focuses on outcomes and believe that you can deliver your best work, working anywhere, anytime.
They believe in Wellness First. That wellness goes beyond team celebrations and birthday parties.
Their holistic approach to wellness gives you opportunities to recharge, connect and explore, at and outside work.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide pre-sales support to the sales team and technical consultancy to their customers.
Gather requirements analysis and design, conduct proof of concepts and assist with deployment.
Help customers understand the client's technology, products and services and be a trusted advisor.
Understanding customers business pain points / requirements, formulate and present the Cloud solutions and transformation strategy.
A technology liaison to address customer enquiries and manage customer trials.
Lead in RFP preparation and response, manager customer trails and proof of Concepts (POC).
Provide market feedback to product managers that can be used to influence product roadmap.
A key KPI is the revenue of the sales team members that the presales person is supporting.
REQUIREMENTS
Experienced in Pre-sales, POC, consultancy or project implementation
Deep technical experience in any of the cloud domains like AWS Cloud, GCP or Azure.
Preferred experience of working on large projects involving multiple sites across the region
Comfortable with dealing with clients at all levels with excellent presentation & communication skills.
Ability to build and maintain professional relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Energetic and positive attitude

Job Description :
Job summary
Do you have a knack for analyzing business deals and developing commercial terms that represent a win-win outcome for all parties Can you distill complex scenarios and simplify them to the essentials, and craft elegant terms that are easy to understand and apply Do you love to analyze data, and drive simplification and strategic initiatives Are you great at collaborating with multiple functions and stakeholders to build alignment around approaches If the answer is yes to all, this might be the perfect role for you!

The Public Sector Business Desk under Amazon Web Services is looking for a Business Desk Manager to support the Asian Pacific (APJ) public sector business. Partnering with Sales, you will work with customers and internal teams (Legal, Finance, Capture/Bid, Operations, Service teams, and others) to structure, negotiate, and close deals. The ideal candidate will have significant experience in crafting non-standard deals and negotiating commercial terms with customers. You will have a background to model terms that reflect the best interests of the business and the customer (procurement to C-Level executives). The ideal candidate will also have technical depth (cloud, SaaS, software, and etc.) to help and guide customers procure cloud technologies and services. The ability to be influential and collaborate effectively across multiple organizations and teams is key. You must have high business judgment and a keen sense of ownership to deliver results. Executive presence and ability to present the complex in a clear and concise manner to the senior management team.

Key job responsibilities
. Serve as a key member of the APJ Public Sector team to negotiate and assist in closing deals, and increase deal velocity.
. Working directly with customers, field teams, leaders, services/support teams, and AWS leadership teams - provide leadership, identify customer blockers/enablers, and close issues.
. Understand the business and technical requirements of customers, and work closely with internal teams to craft appropriate deal terms and remove obstacles/friction.
. Assist with complex contract negotiations and manage internal deal review processes. Including collaborating with internal teams such as Legal, Finance, Partner, Capture, Proposal, Operations, Service teams, and etc.
. Support the Public Sector APJ business and other worldwide teams with custom pricing.
. Analyze trends, formulate projections, create financial models, evaluate alternatives, and provide recommendations to drive deal closure.
. Building new/improve existing data reporting and processes. Report on monthly, quarterly and annual pipeline metrics and business forecasts inclusive of Run Rate, Opportunity and Contractual elements.
. Train and work closely with local field teams to ensure awareness of the program and related processes.
. As the local Business Desk representative, contribute to efforts to improve existing constructs, processes, and programs.
. Provide management with deal insights/analytics, metrics-based reporting, and ad-hoc reporting.
. Special focus in WWPS India and SE Asia deals.

Basic Qualifications :
. BA/BS degree equivalent experience
. At least 5+ years of experience working as business desk/deal desk/licensing specialist/sales operations
. Fluency in English (written and spoken) and one other ASEAN languages
. Prior work experience in the technology industry
. Proficiency in Excel Modeling and working with reporting tools
. Strong analytical, communication, and presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to customers, partners, and internal cross-functional team

Preferred Qualifications :
. Advanced degree or relevant experience
. Knowledge of APJ public sector
. Experience with cloud computing or related field
. Familiar with sales productivity tools such as Salesforce.com and Content Management Solutions
. Adept in a fast-paced environment, and able to navigate multiple ongoing priorities and ambiguities

column1: Partner Development Manager, SAP APJ Leader
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for an experienced Partner Development Manager (PDM) to lead one of our strategic Global System Integrators (GSI). As a PDM within AWS, you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share and adoption of the AWS cloud computing platform with one of our largest partners.

Responsibilities include: development and execution of SAP partner strategy owning the executive relationships with key partners, creating pipeline, driving sales execution, empowering large cloud practices and much more.

By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, along with managing the day-to-day interactions, you will be responsible for driving our SAP top line revenue growth and overall market adoption.

The ideal candidate will possess SAP business/channel sales background that enables them to engage at the MD/ VP/ CEO level, as well as a sales background that enables them to grow pipeline. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

Roles & Responsibilities:
. Experience working with enterprise large partners to develop and execute a partnering strategy, training, and joint sales and Go to Market (GTM) programs for our SAP business.
.
. Engage the partner field sales organization, channels and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for both parties.
.
. Define a strategic SAP Partner Plan and ensure it's in line with the AWS strategic direction. This includes developing establishing a process to track the progress toward goals.
.
. Set and manage revenue targets and work with the partners and AWS sales organizations to achieve/exceed goals.
.
. Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using SAP on AWS.
.
. Experience with CRM systems, data warehousing and other analytic tools to establish detailed metrics for tracking purposes.
.
. Deliver strategic business reviews to the senior leadership team.
.
. Manage complex contract negotiations involving legal, marketing and business terms.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 10+ years of sales and/or partner development experience in the software/technology industry.
. Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
. Influence and manage internal & external stakeholders to work together for a common goal
. Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics, with hands on experience negotiating enterprise contracts
. Strong language (English) public speaking and writing skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences
. Strong SAP technical and/or business solutions acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/ disruptive technologies
. Ability to think and work creatively to develop unique joint value propositions and product strategy within AWS and in the partner's organization
. Ability to think big, be bold, set clear multi-year partnership direction

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Prior experience in large scale, enterprise sales, partner/channel sales and/or business development roles
. Prior experience working with/for GSIs in customer facing roles
. Understands software technologies, including SaaS and Cloud
. Experience using Salesforce.com, Excel, Tableau and other data & analytics business tool
. Post Graduate IT or MBA degrees
. AWS Certified
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Intrusion Detection Systems (ie. Checkpoint, McAfee)
Endpoint Detection and Response (ie. Crowdstrike, Windows Defender)

Knowledge of ICS/OT technologies is a plus
Security certifications such as ECSA, CompTIA Security+, CISSP, OSCP, SANS certifications, Splunk certifications or Azure certifications is advantageous

Have excellent communication skills
Strong team player with good attention to detail and capable of juggling multiple ongoing projects

column7:
Job Description :
Talkers Talk, Builders Build. Do you love to innovate on behalf of customers Do you thrive on solving challenges working with a diverse set of solutions building products for a wide set of industries Do you have a passion for thought leadership in technology We are looking for a Senior Solutions Architect to join the Analytics team, and it could be you!

As an Analytics Solutions Architect, you will get hands on with customers, not only presenting ideas, but also developing code snippets, how-tos, white papers, blogs, sample dashboards, labs, and presentations to evangelize BI design patterns and best practices. You will also mentor and train the broader SA population within AWS, teaching them how to integrate Amazon Analytic Solutions appropriately into development architectures.

The ideal candidate will
Be great fun to work with. Our company credo is Work hard. Have fun. Make history. As the right candidate, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge.

Enjoy working with analytic tools. You have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing systems for some of the world's fastest growing companies.
At AWS, customer obsession is in our DNA. You will represent the voice of the customer in field engagements with AWS specialist sales, business development, and service teams.

As part of a Solutions Architecture team, you produce and validate reference architectures and customer adoption for AWS Analytics tools like Amazon QuickSight.

Specific responsibilities include:

. Designing solutions and prototypes for customers. Develop solutions that make the best use of Amazon QuickSight and educate customers on how to integrate dashboards into their custom applications. Collaborate with AWS field sales, training, and support teams to ensure customer success.
. Partnering with customer account teams, Business Development Managers and Analytics Service teams to accelerate customer adoption and revenue attainment.
. Acting as technical liaison between customers and the service engineering teams, providing product improvement feedback to AWS developers and accelerating the adoption of new features in customer deployments.
. Sharing what you know by capturing best-practice knowledge from engineering and field teams, including reference architectures and patterns amongst the worldwide AWS solution architect community in order to build a strong worldwide database and analytics community.
. Exhibiting thought leadership. Evangelize AWS Services and Analytics Solutions that benefit customers. Share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public speaking events such as AWS Summit and AWS re:Invent.

Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, MIS, Computer Science or Engineering discipline OR equivalent work experience
. 5+ years of experience with a Business Intelligence tool
. 2+ years of experience with development languages such as Python
. Experience working with customers and stakeholders and supporting account managers in a pre-sales capacity
Preferred Qualifications :
. Good communication skills
. Available for travel up to 25%
. Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services
. Hands-on experience with Amazon QuickSight
. Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of Big Data processing, Database, Data Warehousing and Data Sciences
. Deep understanding of data, application, server, and network security
. Experience with Statistics, Machine Learning, Natural Language Query, and Predictive Modelling
. Current implementation and architecture experience in two or more of big data, data warehousing, data lake, operational analytics, data migration, and integration scenarios. (Amazon EMR, Hadoop, Spark, R, Presto, Hive, Amazon Redshift, Teradata, Vertica, Glue, Data Migration Services)

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.
CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY
At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

How would you like to use your engineering or supply chain experience and join the fastest growing ecommerce company in south-east Asia If you are passionate about developing and reapplying data analytics, modeling and simulation technologies to design and optimize supply chain planning & automation, this role is a fit for you!
We build new and modify old assets to drive efficiency and scale in our supply chain planning, bringing new state of the art exponential technologies to life and scale for the business with supply chain analytics and tech products.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Possess strong accountability to influence others and to be responsible for making decisions
Collect data on retail operations.
Analyze data to identify areas of retail operations to improve efficiency.
Develop and execute projects to enhance retail operations
Measure retail operations performance and report to management.
Work with the commercial, planning, logistics, product and tech to enhance service delivery.
Gather insights and contribute to value add to the complete retail operations processes and optimization programs.
Design, develop and maintain scalable (automated) reports that track progress towards plans
Provide critical thinking and influence cross functionally on streamlining processes within Lazada various business units.
Work closely with business to understand business needs and translate the requirements to engineering teams for new product development.
Define, plan and manage the roll out of business product, new features and enhancement.
Communicate program and project status across a wide range of stakeholders and leadership levels
Define, track and report program success metrics
Job description
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's or an advanced qualification in Computer Science, business, engineering, finance or related field
2+ years of retail experience or cloud computing/technology
1-2 years of experience in program, project, or product management, or leading an implementation of a product.

Experience with data visualization (Tableau, QuickSight, Power BI)
Experience in project management tool/app

Ability to influence cross functionally across engineering, deployment, commercial, procurement and external partners
Excellent creative thinking skills with emphasis on developing innovative solutions to solve complex problems that may not have one clear answer
Program management with integrated scheduling and milestone tracking. Able to juggle multiple priorities.
Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to thrive in a startup-like environment
Able to work independently with minimum supervision

Job Description :
Job summary
Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for world class candidates to lead and manage our partnerships with the leading global systems integrators. Do you have the business savvy and industry expertise necessary to position Amazon as the technology platform of the future You will work directly with partners to drive exponential growth through the development of their practice areas, skill sets, go-to-market with AWS.
Your responsibilities as Partner Development Manager, GSI within our APAC business relationship is to build executive and field relationships with an AWS Premier Global System Integrator on the cusp of incredible growth in the APAC region. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with this partner, you will be responsible for driving top line revenue growth, capability development, major strategic agreements, and overall end customer adoption across all market segments. The ideal candidate will possess the business background that enables them to engage at the CXO level, the channel experience to understand the needs and capabilities of their partner, and the sales background needed to easily interact with customers and sales/field reps. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

Key job responsibilities
. Work with AWS APAC & Global sales managers and your partner to define and execute joint sales and go to market programs.
. Manage and drive joint sales engagements between the partner and AWS sales teams
. Serve as a key member of the business development team in helping to define and deliver the joint solution set and supporting collateral for industry and service campaigns.
. Engage the partner's field sales organization, channels, and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for AWS.
. Set a strategic business development plan for target market segments and ensure it is in-line with the AWS strategic direction.
. Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using AWS.
. Work closely with the partner's customer base to ensure they are successful using our web services, making sure they have the technical resources required.
. Ensure that AWS is the partner's preferred cloud computing platform across all product lines.
. Understand the technical and capability requirements of our partners and work closely with internal training and certification teams to equip the partner to deliver outcomes on AWS for their clients.
. Operational Excellence, the ability to identify the key data to manage the Alliance, prepare and present business reviews to senior executive management teams both at the partner and AWS.

About the team
Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Basic Qualifications :
. 7+ years of sales, business development and/or partner management experience
. Previous experience working for, or working closely with, a global system integrator
. Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
. Proven experience driving revenue through partners with structured programs

Preferred Qualifications :
. Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics
. Strong presentation, written and operational skills coupled with the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
. Experience working within the cloud category is highly desired
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
. Master's Degree in business or related field
. Visible IT industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT infrastructure, professional services, outsourcing, and cloud adoption
. Experience building workforce capabilities in/with large system integrators
. Broad based technology experience including cloud computing, data, AI/ML, networking, security, storage and ongoing infrastructure management
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Do you like helping customers and partners solve technical problems Would you like to do this using the latest cloud computing technologies Are you an expert in SAP products and technologies Do you have a knack for helping companies understand SAP application architectures and integration approaches Do you want to be part of the SAP Specialist team in ASEAN helping to establish Amazon Web Services as the leading cloud computing platform for SAP solutions and customers This role helps our customers who enjoy their SAP technology bring it to AWS cloud.
AWS and SAP have been collaborating since SAP became a customer in 2008. Together, we have certified AWS to support most SAP solutions, brought purpose built EC2 instances to market to support SAP customer needs, and helped SAP leverage AWS services to power several of their SaaS and PaaS offerings like Concur, SuccessFactors (for government agencies), HANA Enterprise Cloud (HEC), and SAP Cloud Platform. AWS has been supporting SAP workloads for customers longer than any other cloud provider (since 2011), has more customers (5,000+ across all segments) than any other cloud provider, is certified to support the largest public cloud (native) SAP S/4HANA (48TB) and BW/4HANA (100TB) deployments, and has more SAP HANA cloud native certifications than other cloud providers.

As an SAP on AWS, Solutions Architect you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon's web services across the global SAP customer and partner base. The emphasis being on working directly with customers to develop cloud migration and/or adoption strategies as it relates to their business-critical SAP systems.

Successful candidates will possess deep technical skill in both SAP products and cloud computing. You will have customer facing skills that will enable you to represent AWS cloud solutions well, not only to customers but to the broader SAP community including customers, partners, developers, & architects. The ideal candidate should also have demonstrated the ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges. Strong written skills is a requirement.

Key job responsibilities
As a key member of the Specialist team working to ensure SAP customer success on the AWS platform, you will act as an Amazon ambassador. Your technical expertise and operational excellence will influence the team's decisions and drive secure and robust solutions. You will convey best practices around AWS services and influence customers to allocate appropriate resources for adopting them. You should not only be passionate about delivering great customer service and deploying SAP solutions in AWS cloud, but should also be obsessed with accelerating the customers successful adoption of AWS.

This includes:
. Lead or Support technical engagements with SAP customers in the ASEAN region.
. Focus on SAP within AWS, delivering strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon's web services across the ASEAN SAP customer and partner base.
. Act as an Amazon ambassador in customer and partner engagements.
. Working directly with customers to develop cloud migration and/or adoption strategies as it relates to their business-critical SAP systems.
. Applying deep technical skill in both SAP solutions and cloud computing, as well as customer facing skill, to represent AWS in public speaking forums.
. Strategic customer assessments of SAP business, product, and technical challenges.
. Capture and share best-practice knowledge for deploying, running and managing SAP solutions on AWS.
. Key membership of SAP on AWS Go-To-Market team working to ensure SAP customer success on the AWS platform (post live advisory and support).
. Significant travel may be required.
Basic Qualifications :
. Excellent SAP administration (Basis), pre-sales, infrastructure and cloud experience
. Highly technical and analytical, possessing 5+ years of IT consulting experience as a technical specialist in enterprise customer or partner facing roles providing deal level support and enablement.
. Experience with SAP cloud migrations
. Experience working with large and complex enterprise customers and consulting partners
. Breadth of experience in multiple of the following domains of Enterprise IT: Infrastructure architecture Database architecture IP Networking IT Security Data Center Operations Software design or development
. Strong presentation and written communication skills high degree of comfort with technical and Executive audiences.
. Experience working in a fast-paced and highly cross-functional organization.
. Proven track record of driving results, and effectively leading work with a variety of organisations, management levels, cultures, and personalities.
. Travel up to 40% within market and 2-3 times per year to destinations outside the market
Preferred Qualifications :
. Broad knowledge of the entire SAP platform stack.
. Deep experience with SAP HANA.
. Previous experience with Cloud and architecting SAP solutions on Cloud a plus
. Technical degrees in computer science, software engineering, or math highly desired.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column1: Partner Development Manager, SAP APJ Leader

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for an experienced Partner Development Manager (PDM) to lead one of our strategic Global System Integrators (GSI). As a PDM within AWS, you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share and adoption of the AWS cloud computing platform with one of our largest partners.

Responsibilities include: development and execution of SAP partner strategy owning the executive relationships with key partners, creating pipeline, driving sales execution, empowering large cloud practices and much more.

By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, along with managing the day-to-day interactions, you will be responsible for driving our SAP top line revenue growth and overall market adoption.

The ideal candidate will possess SAP business/channel sales background that enables them to engage at the MD/ VP/ CEO level, as well as a sales background that enables them to grow pipeline. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

Roles & Responsibilities:
. Experience working with enterprise large partners to develop and execute a partnering strategy, training, and joint sales and Go to Market (GTM) programs for our SAP business.
.
. Engage the partner field sales organization, channels and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for both parties.
.
. Define a strategic SAP Partner Plan and ensure it's in line with the AWS strategic direction. This includes developing establishing a process to track the progress toward goals.
.
. Set and manage revenue targets and work with the partners and AWS sales organizations to achieve/exceed goals.
.
. Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using SAP on AWS.
.
. Experience with CRM systems, data warehousing and other analytic tools to establish detailed metrics for tracking purposes.
.
. Deliver strategic business reviews to the senior leadership team.
.
. Manage complex contract negotiations involving legal, marketing and business terms.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 10+ years of sales and/or partner development experience in the software/technology industry.
. Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
. Influence and manage internal & external stakeholders to work together for a common goal
. Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics, with hands on experience negotiating enterprise contracts
. Strong language (English) public speaking and writing skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences
. Strong SAP technical and/or business solutions acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/ disruptive technologies
. Ability to think and work creatively to develop unique joint value propositions and product strategy within AWS and in the partner's organization
. Ability to think big, be bold, set clear multi-year partnership direction

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Prior experience in large scale, enterprise sales, partner/channel sales and/or business development roles
. Prior experience working with/for GSIs in customer facing roles
. Understands software technologies, including SaaS and Cloud
. Experience using Salesforce.com, Excel, Tableau and other data & analytics business tool

column6: Mendix - UI Solutions Architect  Apac
column7:
Job Description :

Mendix is a low-code app development platform: First, what is low-code Low-code is a visual approach to software development that enables you to abstract and automate every step of the application lifecycle. Gartner predicts that by 2024, low-code application development will be responsible for more than 65% of application development activity. Mendix is repeatedly ranked a Leader in analyst reports from Gartner and Forrester. In the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Multiexperience Development Platforms, Mendix placed at the very top of the Leaders quadrant. Mendix, the global leader in enterprise low-code, was created to promote collaboration between Business & IT teams. Thousands of forward-thinking companies around the world like Ford Auto, Rabobank Netherlands, Zurich Insurance, and Red Bull, can unleash their best ideas faster with the help of the Mendix Platform. Mendix is a Siemens Business: Siemens is a Top 10 Global Software Company and a leader on Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies in the World! With the acquisition of Mendix in 2018, Siemens Digital Industries Software is driving transformation to enhance the digital enterprise where engineering, manufacturing and electronics meet the future of innovation. Mendix employees have the opportunity to work in a hyper-growth environment with the support of Siemens unbeatable market position and resources. As an UI Solutions Architect, you will act as a UI design expert supporting our sales pursuits where you will be hands-on showcasing the art of the possible Responsibilities: Educating our customers/prospects on the capabilities of our front-end development, UI design, and platform Advising our customers/prospects on how to leverage UX within their application portfolio and organization. Designing UIs for applications by leveraging a client's existing brand assets Communicating best practices with respect to UI designs Working collaboratively with the extended Solutions Architecture team to deliver compelling UIs on top of functional proof of concepts Developing applications through use of the Mendix Studio Pro and UI design tools Multitasking on challenging agile projects simultaneously Requirements: Higher education experience in user interaction design or graphical design Over 3 years of work experience as a front-end developer and UI designer ideally within an Agile environment Experienced in designing mobile friendly websites and web-based applications Demonstrated front-end development experience Demonstrated experience building UI deliverables such as wireframes, design mockups user workflows, functional specifications, and/or style guides. A solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and Sass Experienced with proven UI design tool such as Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD Basic understanding of JavaScript is a plus This role may require you to travel up to 50% to client sites both locally and internationally Working at Mendix Mendix has been recognized as a Best Cloud Computing Company to Work For by Forbes. With offices in 16+ countries including headquarters in Rotterdam and Boston, Mendix provides an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code. While each employee brings their own unique cultures and personalities to the workplace, we collectively live by our Mendix Blue Guiding Principles: While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our MendixBlue guiding principles. Being MendixBlue means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It's kind of a big deal. We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, alwaysyou belong here. We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long termyou belong here. We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask what if and work to find a way or make oneyou belong here. We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you're up for learning from your failuresyou belong here. We hear every voice. Inflated egos don't last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win - regardless of who they come fromyou belong here. We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it doneyou belong here. We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we're happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you doyou belong here. Organization: Digital Industries Company: Siemens Industry Software Pte Ltd Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

column6: Cloud Computing  Data Structures  Scrum  Google Analytics  Business Requirements  Modeling  Architectural  Project Management  Product Development  Technical Product Management
column7:
About Syfe
Syfe is one of the fastest-growing digital investment platforms in Singapore. We provide a holistic investment solution for retail users - from passively managed wealth portfolios that are personalized and diversified using proprietary algorithms to active trading of single stock securities. Our mission is to enable sophisticated investing at a low cost.
In July 2021, we closed a S$40 million Series B funding round led by Valar Ventures, just 9 months after raising Series A. Our existing investors followed on their original investment in a short time frame, which speaks volumes about our rapid growth and our future ahead. Moving forward, we will accelerate our expansion across geographies, launch new products and grow our team.
The Syfe team consists of industry experts from finance, e-commerce, and technology. We come from startups as well as large corporations. Excellence in execution is in our DNA. We aim to become Asia Pacific's largest Digital Investment Manager by leveraging technology to provide a superior investing experience for our customers.
Syfe was named Best Digital Advisory Solution at DigFin Group Innovation 2021 and Top Startups in to look out for in 2022 by TechCrunchFind out more about us at www.syfe.com
Press links - Bloomberg, Business Times, TechCrunch
The Right Profile
We are looking for a Technical Product Manager with deep experience in conceptualizing and executing large impact products. To scale up successfully we need owner-mindset PMs who can figure out areas of opportunity and can drive projects with cross-functional teams. This role will be responsible for shaping our future products and will be working closely with important stakeholders.
While it's not necessary to already have a deep understanding of finance, you should be keen to learn about investing. The idea of helping everyday people wrangle their hardest money problems should excite you.
Responsibilities
Manage platform products that power Syfe across multiple markets.
Work with external partners and vendors to integrate and expand Syfe's platform.
Drive and manage discussions on the Syfe platform's current and future capabilities.
Work with the engineering teams and stakeholders to define the product requirements
Groom, prioritise, and manage the backlog while balancing user value and business requirements
Minimum Qualifications
5+ years of PM experience in online businesses.
Experience in developing and managing platform products.
Worked in a cross-functional stakeholder setup - Internal and external partners
Comfortable with performing the initial feasibility analysis and handling API services related discussions with external partners and vendors
Technical understanding of the systems and technologies behind the product, their limitations, scaling factors, and high-level understanding of architectural decisions.
Experience in SQL, Postman, Google Analytics is an added advantage.

column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Are you interested in help driving and overseeing a Go-to-Market (GTM) plan for Microsoft Platforms at AWS

As a Business Development (BD) leader at AWS, you will contribute to the overall performance of our Japan business, measured by revenue growth, net new customers, and reference wins. You'll have a broad role - part market maker, part operator, and part general manager - and will build a strategy focused on winning new customer segments and growing existing customer segments for the long term.

In this role, you will build and execute sales plays, content and tools to build pipeline, acting as the voice of the Microsoft customer to the AWS service teams, helping win lighthouse customers in key industries and supporting the field on the rapid close of complex deals.

Are you a motivated self-starter with an analytical mind Do you want to work on the forefront of the latest innovations and technologies Do you seek the opportunity to work with a diverse set of customers, opportunities and markets as part of a team focused on increasing adoption of Amazon Web Services for Microsoft platforms on AWS

Come build the future with us.
Basic Qualifications :
. Track record of building rapport with senior C-level stakeholders
. Business development, partner or BD experience, working in customer and partner facing roles in the Microsoft ecosystem, with focus on infrastructure or cloud platforms
. Proven ability to deliver results in a matrix organization (leveraging multiple functions and teams)
. Prior experience growing Microsoft customers
. Ability to communicate to a high standard in fluent English
Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience selling Windows Server, SQL Server or Azure

. Experience working at Microsoft or a systems integrator partner
. Experience with data center migrations
