This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
At Amazon.com, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Cloud Computing is revolutionizing Information Technology. Since early 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS customers can requisition compute power, storage, and other services-gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as their business demands them. Customers pay only for what they use, with no up-front expenses or long-term commitments, making AWS the most cost-effective, flexible way to deliver their applications to their customers and clients. Since 2006 AWS is the leader in the global IaaS cloud computing space and is continually growing.

Would you like to be a central part of a recruiting team that is responsible for fueling the rapid growth of AWS globally Are you a builder Do you thrive in high growth ambiguous environments Are you a process oriented data driven recruiting leader that loves to dive deep to fix complex operational challenges allowing for greater scalability and global impact

The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Recruiting team is seeking a talented, customer-focused recruiting expert to join our global recruiting organization supporting AWS. This role will be responsible for working closely with various business stakeholders to define the sourcing strategy, generate high caliber talents and close top candidates all within a fast-moving and super dynamic environment. You will have the opportunity to draw on your extensive knowledge of Talent Acquisition and functional areas of the business and forge dynamic relationships with business leaders, hiring managers and HR business partners.

Core Responsibilities:
. Work closely with business in order to deeply understand teams organization structure, responsibilities, strengths/weaknesses and key business drivers. Utilize this information to develop most effective recruiting strategies.
. Build and maintain network of potential candidates through proactive market research and on-going relationship management, gauging chemistry of candidates for fit and motivation rather than simply sell a role. Meanwhile, manage to ensure all sourcing channels are sufficiently utilized, including but not limited to employee referrals, career portals, search firms, job fairs, etc.
. Consult on ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within Amazon's mission to deliver the highest quality results to the customer. Also, articulated in writing recruiting plans with deliverables, timelines and a formal tracking process.
. Active participation in the full cycle recruiting efforts, including emphasis on the capability of assessment skills to help evaluating candidates and ensuring the highest bar. Lead final assessment and selection process.
. In charge of the offer proposal and negotiation process.
. Manage well on all the data associated with the recruitment process. Data-driven thinking and systematic approaches in achieving the operation excellence.
. Emphasis on continuous improvement, as such it is expected that you will spend time to ensure ongoing education of hiring managers and interviews on recruitment best practice and interview skills training.
. Implement the recruitment tools/systems in region through active collaboration with global contacts.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Solid track record/experience in a search firm progressive recruiting experience, with a heavy focus on sourcing and candidate generation
. Experience building and utilizing a variety of sourcing plans and tools, including proactive phone and internet research.
. Experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and client relationships.
. Strong client focus and commitment to continuous improvement ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships, continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to delivering candidates to the customer.
. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
. Ability to execute recruiting strategy, including employer promotion in the marketplace, candidate management, and diversity sourcing.
. Independant and able to work with little direct supervision.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Analytic skills with ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and the recruiting team.
. Strong consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment
. Experience in recruiting in the region

Here at Amazon -
We embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion.
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment.
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column1: Principal Machine Learning (ML) Advisor, AWS Startups
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
The AWS Startup Business Development team champions and works alongside the world's highest-potential startups from conception to exit. Our mission is to ensure that they achieve success by accelerating their scientific, engineering and commercial efforts though our people, technology, knowledge, programs, and relationships.

We're expanding our efforts to help such ventures better take advantage of AWS capabilities in data science, machine learning (ML), and artificial intelligence (AI).

We're looking for an AI/ML subject matter expert who will be seen as a peer by startup founders/CxOs (at all stages of startup maturity), institutional investors, and other key influencers in the ML and startup ecosystem. Ideally, this individual would hold a PhD in an ML-related field and be the exited founder/CxO (or early operator) of one or more ML-related startups.

The role requires a keen sense of ownership, scrappiness, initiative, and a track record of executing in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities, and limited resources.

Key job responsibilities
. Working with the founders/leaders of venture-backed startups to 1) identify their technical and commercial challenges/opportunities 2) map those needs onto people, technology, knowledge, programs, relationships across Amazon that could potentially help and 3) mobilize those assets to work on behalf of these startup customers
. Developing and holding relationships with key influencers in the startup ecosystem focused on AI/ML (e.g., venture funds, accelerators, university labs and programs). Activities include putting Amazon assets to work on behalf of their portfolio companies, driving customer and partner relationships for the portfolio, jointly producing thought leadership and educational events and/or the broader startup ecosystem.
. Collaborating with generalist colleagues across the global Startup Business Development team, particularly across APJ, to better serve the needs of customers leveraging AI/ML technologies at all stages of startup life from conception to exit.
. Discovering, capturing and reporting back patterns and learnings from the field about challenges and opportunities as they relate to AI/ML. Continuously assessing the AI/ML market landscape as it relates to startups.
. Producing AI/ML thought leadership and technical-leaning content, workshops, and events for the startup ecosystem. Serving as a technical evangelist and AI/ML subject matter expert within AWS and externally.
. Informing, influencing, and contributing to the work of other AI/ML-related colleagues across AWS and Amazon including sales, marketing, business development, solutions architecture and product teams. Contributing to the development of our AI/ML strategy.
. Conceiving, authoring, securing support for, launching and executing new initiatives and programs to meet the needs of startup customers as they relate to AI/ML.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. MS or PhD in Computer Science, ideally with a focus on ML or a related field with customer engagement experience
. Hands-on experience with machine learning algorithms, model development, common frameworks, workflow tools, and applied AI (e.g., CV, NLP).
. Knowledge of core cloud computing concepts including compute, storage, networking, databases, and higher order capabilities including serverless and IoT Ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate among various AWS services, as well as top use cases for popular startup industries
. Proven ability to build trust and manage relationships with the C-level leadership of startups, managing directors of investor organizations, and other key influencers in the startup ecosystem
. Proven ability to execute as an individual contributor in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities, and limited resources
. Strong verbal and written communications skills
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Exited founder/CxO/operator of one or more ventures that involved data science, machine learning, or artificial intelligence
. 10+ years of customer-engagement business experience
. Publications in peer-reviewed conferences or journals
. Speaking engagements at ML conferences and industry events
. AWS SA Associate or equivalent certification
. AWS ML Specialist or equivalent certification
. Software development experience (Python preferred)

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Talkers Talk, Builders Build. Do you love to innovate on behalf of customers Do you thrive on solving challenges working with a diverse set of solutions building products for a wide set of industries Do you have a passion for thought leadership in technology We are looking for a Senior Solutions Architect to join the Analytics team, and it could be you!

As an Analytics Solutions Architect, you will get hands on with customers, not only presenting ideas, but also developing code snippets, how-tos, white papers, blogs, sample dashboards, labs, and presentations to evangelize BI design patterns and best practices. You will also mentor and train the broader SA population within AWS, teaching them how to integrate Amazon Analytic Solutions appropriately into development architectures.

The ideal candidate will
Be great fun to work with. Our company credo is Work hard. Have fun. Make history. As the right candidate, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge.

Enjoy working with analytic tools. You have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing systems for some of the world's fastest growing companies.
At AWS, customer obsession is in our DNA. You will represent the voice of the customer in field engagements with AWS specialist sales, business development, and service teams.

As part of a Solutions Architecture team, you produce and validate reference architectures and customer adoption for AWS Analytics tools like Amazon QuickSight.

Specific responsibilities include:

. Designing solutions and prototypes for customers. Develop solutions that make the best use of Amazon QuickSight and educate customers on how to integrate dashboards into their custom applications. Collaborate with AWS field sales, training, and support teams to ensure customer success.
. Partnering with customer account teams, Business Development Managers and Analytics Service teams to accelerate customer adoption and revenue attainment.
. Acting as technical liaison between customers and the service engineering teams, providing product improvement feedback to AWS developers and accelerating the adoption of new features in customer deployments.
. Sharing what you know by capturing best-practice knowledge from engineering and field teams, including reference architectures and patterns amongst the worldwide AWS solution architect community in order to build a strong worldwide database and analytics community.
. Exhibiting thought leadership. Evangelize AWS Services and Analytics Solutions that benefit customers. Share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public speaking events such as AWS Summit and AWS re:Invent.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, MIS, Computer Science or Engineering discipline OR equivalent work experience
. 5+ years of experience with a Business Intelligence tool
. 2+ years of experience with development languages such as Python
. Experience working with customers and stakeholders and supporting account managers in a pre-sales capacity
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Good communication skills
. Available for travel up to 25%
. Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services
. Hands-on experience with Amazon QuickSight
. Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of Big Data processing, Database, Data Warehousing and Data Sciences
. Deep understanding of data, application, server, and network security
. Experience with Statistics, Machine Learning, Natural Language Query, and Predictive Modelling
. Current implementation and architecture experience in two or more of big data, data warehousing, data lake, operational analytics, data migration, and integration scenarios. (Amazon EMR, Hadoop, Spark, R, Presto, Hive, Amazon Redshift, Teradata, Vertica, Glue, Data Migration Services)

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.
CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY
At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Profile Summary:
In this role, you will mainly be responsible for working with continuous integration, continuous delivery of deployment pipelines amongst other daily activities. You will be part of a diversified, innovative and highly skilled team. As part of this dynamic role, you will work closely with other platform / application teams to inculcate and influence the DevOps & SRE way of working
Job Description:
Assess and evaluate suitability of applications to be on-boarded on the DevOps pipeline
On-board new applications and build delivery pipelines if needed
Well versed with Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery practices and able to apply them
Well versed with version control practices like GiT
Well versed with container architecture, container standards, container design, container building and able to assess and establish the need for containers
Well versed with Infrastructure as a Code principles and technologies
Familiar with SRE Practice Areas such as, self-service automation, SLAs and SLOs, incident management and post mortems, performance engineering, capacity and scalability as well as distributed design
Who we are looking for:
Competencies
Expertise in Kubernetes Deployments and Manifests as well as Dockerfile Composition
Expertise on creating Helm Charts for deployments
Knowledge of Jenkins or other CI/CD Platforms
Knowledge of Cloud Computing and familiar with Azure, AWS, etc...
Expertise in Linux OS (RHCE/LPI Certification will be an advantage)
Knowledge of networking devices such as Firewalls, Load Balancers, etc...
Knowledge of GIT
Coding Skills in some of the following languages (Python, Java, Go, NodeJS)
Software Engineering Experience would be an advantage
Architecture / Systems Design Knowledge
Engineering Best Practices
UI/UX Development Skills would be an advantage
Personal Traits
Excellent problem analysis and solving skills, meticulous & methodical
Strong attention to detail
Works well across different functions
Strong sense of drive and commitment to deliver on responsibilities
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Works well in a dynamic environment
Working Experience
More than 5-year experience working in a DevOps / SRE role
What We Offer
We work in an open office that encourages collaboration and innovation between teams and departments. We believe in a culture that flattens the hierarchy and focuses on accountability, empowerment and trust in everyone within our organization
Education
Bachelor's in computer science, Computer Engineering or equivalent. Candidates without a degree, but have extensive experience in DevOps / SRE will be considered as well
Language
Fluent in both spoken and written English

column6: Mendix - APAC IT Support Specialist
column7:
Job Description :

Mendix is a low-code app development platform: First, what is low-code Low-code is a visual approach to software development that enables you to abstract and automate every step of the application lifecycle. Gartner predicts that by 2024, low-code application development will be responsible for more than 65% of application development activity. Mendix is repeatedly ranked a Leader in analyst reports from Gartner and Forrester. In the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Multiexperience Development Platforms, Mendix placed at the very top of the Leaders quadrant. Mendix, the global leader in enterprise low-code, was created to promote collaboration between Business & IT teams. Thousands of forward-thinking companies around the world like Ford Auto, Rabobank Netherlands, Zurich Insurance, and Red Bull, can unleash their best ideas faster with the help of the Mendix Platform. Mendix is a Siemens Business: Siemens is a Top 10 Global Software Company and a leader on Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies in the World! With the acquisition of Mendix in 2018, Siemens Digital Industries Software is driving transformation to enhance the digital enterprise where engineering, manufacturing and electronics meet the future of innovation. Mendix employees have the opportunity to work in a hyper-growth environment with the support of Siemens unbeatable market position and resources. MANAGE, IMPROVE, AND INNOVATE. GET READY TO USE YOUR TECHNICAL SKILLS TO GO FOR THE BEST SOLUTION. Every day you will work on the most diverse cases for the first line support of Mendix. Dedicated and goal-oriented, you will manage various work environments, and you will take responsibility for making available, keeping, and improving the Mendix workplaces, including applications. Variety in your work is guaranteed! You will work closely with the system administrators, and IT specialists in our solution groups. With your stellar communication skills, service-oriented attitude, and the will to solve problems, you will surprise the customer time and again with a quick solution. ABOUT US Mendix is part of the Siemens organization. Going towards global support with colleagues in EMEA, APAC and US region we will soon go with a follow-the-sun 24/5 approach. COVID-19 SITUATION While the future still includes working from home, after Covid-19 you will be expected to be in the office 1 or 2 days per week. Our office is located in Singapore. OUR TECHNOLOGY STACK Windows 10 MacOS Office 365 applications and portal Azure portal Active Directory (on-premises and Cloud) Intune SharePoint Intune Exchange Online Microsoft Teams RESPONSIBILITIES: First and second-line activities: troubleshooting, advising the end-user for a solution, setting up meetings to resolve outstanding issues. Executing changes and user requests. Registering & monitoring tickets until closing. Proactively identify potential problems & initiate steps towards a possible resolution. GOT WHAT IT TAKES You have at least a diploma. 3 years of proven experience as a first line support engineer. Strong communication skills. You know how to cope in every situation. By asking the right questions in combination with giving some reassurance, you know how to map out and solve problems at lightning speed. At least 1 certificate for ITIL Foundation 3 or 4, Windows 10, or Microsoft Office 365. A structured style of working. This means you always have an overview as well as knowledgeable insight into how to resolve issues and close out active cases. COMPETENCES: Good written and oral communication. Customer and service-oriented friendly. Quality-oriented. Flexible working hours, sometimes working in the evening and in the weekend. Ability to run standby shifts. Ability to read and write in Mandarin, this will be require to support Mandarin speaking users in Mandarin language. Working at Mendix Mendix has been recognized as a Best Cloud Computing Company to Work For by Forbes. With offices in 16+ countries including headquarters in Rotterdam and Boston, Mendix provides an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code. While each employee brings their own unique cultures and personalities to the workplace, we collectively live by our Mendix Blue Guiding Principles: While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our MendixBlue guiding principles. Being MendixBlue means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It's kind of a big deal. We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, alwaysyou belong here. We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long termyou belong here. We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask what if and work to find a way or make oneyou belong here. We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you're up for learning from your failuresyou belong here. We hear every voice. Inflated egos don't last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win - regardless of who they come fromyou belong here. We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it doneyou belong here. We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we're happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you doyou belong here. Organization: Digital Industries Company: Siemens Industry Software Pte Ltd Experience Level: Early Professional Job Type: Full-time

We are looking for a Systems Engineer to maintain, upgrade and manage software, hardware and networks. Resourcefulness is a necessary skill in this role. You should be able to diagnose and resolve problems quickly. You should also have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams and users. Your goal will be to ensure that our client's technology infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently.
Your responsibilities include:
Manage network servers and technology tools
Set up accounts and workstations
Monitor performance and maintain systems according to requirements
Troubleshoot issues and outages
Ensure security through access controls, backups and firewalls
Upgrade systems with new releases and models
Health check reporting

Minimum Diploma in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline; professional certification (e.g. Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA)) is a plus
At least 2 years experience in similar capacity as a System Administrator, network administrator or similar role.

column2: Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited
column6: Oracle  Cloud Computing  Enterprise Software  Excel  CRM  Leadership  Social Media  Marketing Strategy  Strategy  Demand Generation  Public Relations  Digital Marketing  Writing  Team Player  motions
column7:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a highly capable, self-directed Partner Marketing Manager to own the marketing strategy and programs to drive customer adoptions of Enterprise workloads to AWS's cloud computing platform through AWS Partners. If you have a passion for the cloud, experience with marketing enterprise technology applications, love helping partners reach their full potential, and are an expert in designing and implementing joint marketing plans and partner programs at scale then we're looking for you.
AWS gives customers a secure, scalable, global cloud infrastructure while paying only for what they use. Scaling through partners is a key part of how we help customers move to cloud services that power strategic workloads.
In this role, you will be a lead as a subject matter expert on how to drive Enterprise workloads to AWS through partner marketing programs. You will monitor partner marketing performance against key metrics and be an expert resource on marketing processes and guidelines for partners. You will collaborate with peers in marketing team to build mechanisms for consistency and bar-raising delivery across strategic workloads.
The ideal candidate has a passion for technology, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a successful track record in partner marketing. They have a relentless focus on the end customer and love building and running marketing enablement programs that scale and accelerate joint marketing campaigns with partners. This is a unique opportunity to play a highly visible role in an exciting technology business.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with regional partner leadership and field partner marketing to identify priorities, focus partner marketing initiatives, and success metrics.
Innovate and build best-in-class partner marketing programs and motions to successfully drive migration of Oracle and relevant enterprise workloads to AWS through partners.
Develop and monitor partner marketing plans with focus partners to effectively drive customer awareness and adoption of AWS services for enterprise applications.
Market at scale by designing partner marketing programs and campaign templates that can be implemented by global and regional partners.
Drive awareness and demand to AWS partner offerings through AWS-led campaigns and messaging.
Manage inclusion and promotion of partner offerings at AWS events and AWS's strategy at alliance events.
Build and promote customer case studies with partners to provide customers with tangible results and implementation stories.
Become an expert at tracking and reporting systems and process to ensure partner marketing activities are recognized, evaluated, and optimized.
Basic qualifications
7+ years of relevant work experience in partner/enterprise marketing, demand generation in cloud and/or enterprise software space
Build co-marketing for a large global partner for 3 years or account-based enterprise marketing plans
Proven record in establishing and analyzing Return of Marketing Investment metrics and conversant with lead funnel metrics and industry CRM tools
Experience in developing compelling joint content and working knowledge of digital marketing, social media and public relations
Excel in working closely with customer segment, internal cross-functional teams, external agencies and industry associations
Degree/ MBA and equivalent industry experience.
Preferred qualifications
Exceptional writing and communication skills; ability to summarize important insights for senior leadership and cross-functional stakeholders
Demonstrates strong analytical and strategic thinking skills and the ability to translate those skills into creative, marketable programs
Be a natural team player and have a desire to work with others for broader success
The fluid ability to operate successfully in a rapidly changing, ambiguous and undefined environment
Candidate will be able to understand the technology surrounding AWS products and technologies

column1: Regional Digital Marketing Data Planner, Asia Pacific
column6: SEO  Analytical Skills  Ability To Work Independently  Segmentation  Multitasking Skills  Problem Solving  Planner  Written Communications  Attention To Detail  Digital Marketing  Freight  Media Planning  Team Player  Articulate  Storytelling  Decision Making
column7:
Asia-Pacific Regional Marketing is looking for a talented and highly motivated business Data Planner to join us. In this newly created role, based either in Shanghai or Singapore, you will work with Marketing Managers to analyze data and deliver business insights on solutions to guide strategic decisions, and drive product-based campaigns. The candidate will define and execute data-driven, analytical solutions to help solve business problems. This individual will also collaborate with stakeholders from marketing, product, and sales teams to plan and execute sales campaigns for a cluster of local champions, SME customers, and Freight Forwarders, recommend and forecast targets and track progress and results of the campaigns.
Being a data planner at the Regional Marketing is about much more than simply crunching numbers it's about finding compelling insights within data and using your exceptional business and communication skills to translate those insights into action.
As one of the masterminds behind our data-driven campaign planning, forecasting and analysis, you'll spend your time digging into big, complex data sets, customer touch points and journeys. The data will not remain inert in your hands, however, since you'll use your critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills to influence and drive thoughtful and well-informed decision making with marketing and business leaders.
Our team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and customer-centric marketeers are the experience of Maersk, helping global and APA-based entrepreneurs, SMEs both individually and broadly build and grow their presence home and abroad.
Key Responsibilities
This is a hands-on position; the ideal candidate must be willing to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large datasets, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting tools and dashboards in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity, and communicate complex business insights in a clear and precise manner.
Support the full spectrum of regional marketing data analytics activities to target priority the SME segment and personas.
Deep dive into data to investigate trends, topical issues, uncover insights, and explore new opportunities for communications.
Create data reports, visualizations, and meaningful analyses to support our marketing managers in making data-driven decisions.
Partner with internal regional and global stakeholders from cross-functional and products teams, data engineers to capture business requirements, shape data, and set up processes to design and build reporting solutions.
Identify gaps and pioneer new ways to optimize campaign planning and execution, and improve data integrity.
Understand how data, and content should be used to optimize conversion rates for a digital experience
Understand and support execute SEO analysis.
Required competencies and skills
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree is required with emphasis on analytical skills e.g. E-commerce, Statistics, Computer, or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of experience in analytics or business intelligence.
Demonstrated proficiency in analytical work in marketing/sales, or a business operations and analytics environment, including analyzing data with spreadsheet software (e.g. Excel Sheets) and database query (e.g. SQL) experience
Champion of data and visualization with strong, effective presentation and story-telling skills.
Demonstrated ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis to solve business problems and translate the results into actionable deliverables, clearly-written summaries/presentations, and region-wide communications.
Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to articulate complex insights to cross-functional audiences.
Great organizational skills and attention to detail; able to execute and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously.
Team player, but ability to work independently and be a self-starter.
Social media and digital savvy.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with marketing analysis and data-backed customer segmentation is a plus.
Understanding of digital marketing, digital logistics platforms, and solutions.
Business acumen and communication skills; proficiency in translating data into actionable insights and digestible formats for the business.
Highly organized with multi-tasking skills; efficient in ambiguous situations.
Demonstrated ability to work across organizational boundaries.
Knowledge about digital campaign landscape, cloud computing market and technologies.
BA in data analytics, business or related field. Master degree is preferred.

column1: Principal Technical Advisor - FastTrack for Azure
column7:
Azure Customer Experience (CXP) is a fast-growing engineering organization comprised of passionate individuals that drive positive outcomes and experiences, providing technical guidance, advice, and practical solutions. Within the organization, FastTrack for Azure (FTA) is a customer success service to help confidently adopt Azure and cloud best practices, applying a build it right, architect it right, the first time approach. FTA provides expert engineering resources, tools, and a methodical proven engagement process that facilitates the cloud journey for companies around the world.
As part of FTA's expansion efforts, we are building the office of the Chief Technical Advisor, which will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and expertly summarizing knowledge acquired from hundreds of customer engagements, helping Azure engineering teams to prioritize development and improvement efforts for the different cloud services that we offer. The team will also be driving motions to amplify and accelerate knowledge inside the organization, while taking into consideration the latest industry trends. Based on this mission, we are looking for a well-rounded, highly skilled cloud engineer who can act as a recognized technical advisor, with the ability to distill complex problems into clean and intuitive designs, in topics such as computer processing services, data analysis, artificial intelligence, networking, cybersecurity, and IoT messaging.
Act as an expert cloud technical advisor to both Azure engineering and FastTrack for Azure teams around the world, providing practical advice and insights based on personal experience and latest trends.
In collaboration with other FTA teams, gather, analyze, and expertly summarize technical knowledge acquired from real-world customer engagements and feedback, helping Azure engineering teams and senior executives to prioritize development and improvement efforts.
Identify, design, and promote initiatives to amplify and accelerate knowledge acquisition inside the global FTA organization, helping with the prioritization of training efforts.
Directly participate in customer engagements where specialized expertise is required, offering technical guidance to solve complex problems with clean, intuitive designs and solutions.

demonstrated deep technical capabilities as an expert technical advisor, primarily for cloud development on the microsoft azure platform.
a deep understanding of cloud computing technologies, and emerging trends.
minimum of 7 years of experience in software engineering and development.
knowledge of solution development practices and a track record of working closely with large development teams.
proven record of building and growing technical relationships with senior executives.
exceptional leadership skills and community building.
exceptional decision-making, conflict resolution, and follow through.
results driven strong analytical skills with exceptional verbal and written communication.
bs/ba degree, masters in computer science preferred.

We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you're up for learning from your failuresyou belong here. We hear every voice. Inflated egos don't last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win - regardless of who they come fromyou belong here. We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it doneyou belong here. We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we're happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you doyou belong here. Organization: Digital Industries Company: Siemens Industry Software Pte Ltd Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

column7:
Responsibilities
System operation
- Regional support & development for mobile application
- Responsible to handle service request, system support & troubleshooting, user guide/documentation.
- Responsible for system integration testing and user acceptance test.
Requirement
- Diploma/Degree in computer science or information technology or equivalent
- At least 3-5 years of relevant experiences.
- Android & ios app development skill
- Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role.
- Experience building mobile apps using Flutter/native
- Familiarity with MSSQL database using Stored procedures.
- Experience building and testing enterprise scale web APIs
- Deep knowledge of computer science fundamentals.
- Hands on development experience in .Net Core C#/Angular.
- An analytical mind
- Creative thinker with excellent UI/UX sense.
- Responsible, organized and independent.
- Good working attitude and time management.
- Good communication skills.
- Strong problem solving skills.
- Able to work under minimum supervision.

column6: Version Control  Web Services  Kubernetes  Cloud Computing  Design Patterns  Unit Testing  Software Engineering  Application Development  Data Integration  System Design  Continuous Integration  Web Applications  Ansible  Api
column7:
Software engineering takes the central roles for building Traveloka products and systems. You will be responsible for designing, building, improving, or maintaining our web applications, third-party data integration, data API, backend systems, or working with monitoring tools and infrastructure.
You may work on our transaction recording engine, rule engine, business process engine, data applications, devops-related applications, infra cost reduction, system migration, and other new projects.
You will work in cross-functional teams and meet great people regularly from top tier technology, consulting, product, or academic background. We work in an open environment where there are no boundaries or power distance. Everyone is encouraged to speak their mind, propose ideas, influence others, and continuously grow themselves. Get the exposure to multi-aspect, collaborative, intensive startup experience with our recent expansion into Southeast Asia and exploration of new products.
Qualifications:
Passion in software engineering, application development, and/or systems development
Excellent understanding of software engineering concepts, design patterns, and algorithms
10+ years hands-on experience in the relevant technologies
Experience with software engineering best practices including unit testing, continuous integration, continuous deployment and source control
Working knowledge of relational and document-oriented database
Understanding of cloud computing, scalable system design, service-oriented architecture, microservices architecture, serverless architecture and RESTful web services
Experience in version control (Git/SVN/Mercurial) and familiarity with development collaboration tools (GitHub/Phabricator/BitBucket).
Experience in CI/CD like Jenkins/Travis CI/TeamCity and related technologies.
Experience in AWS/GCP/Azure and other technologies like Ansible, Containers, Kubernetes.
Keen on creating tech POCs, improving Eng velocity, and guiding teams on adoption of new technologies
Must thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environment, be willing to take the initiative and be committed to continuous learning
Strong verbal and written communication skills. Able to communicate complex ideas with stakeholders of different background

column6: Application Security  Vulnerability Scanning  Cloud Computing  Application Development  Open Source  Penetration Testing  Networking  Web Security  Ansible  Java  Software Development  Agile Development  Technical Support  remediation  vulnerability research  Audit
column7:
The Security Operational Services (SOS) team from IBM's Enterprise and Technology Security is looking to hire onto our Application Security Tribe. SOS provides a number of standard externally available compliance tools (Application Security, SIEM, Vulnerability Scanning) in an integrated portal that is developed in house.

SOS security specialist at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to protect IBM properties , IBM E&TS, provide completely compliance and audit solution for IBM customer and IBM. Security Operational Service team is providing asset of security and compliance tools for regulation and audit. We are looking for talent for delivery solution of source code protection to IBM development team for IBM product and service. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.

Essential Job Duties:
Provide daily support for source code protection solution include code signing and scanning tools.
Work solution delivery on application security like code scanning and code signing
Consultant and develop CI/CD pipeline solution
Technical support for business development
Co-ordinate extensively with extended SOS teams (networking, infrastructure and leadership) to maintain, establish and deliver the application security services for our clients
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
3+ years of experience working in the cloud computing industry with a focus of sustaining IT services in one or two of the following competencies:.
Automation: RestAPI integration, UCD, Jenkins, Ansible.
Development skill with Java or other related language.
Experience on code scan with related tools for DAST/SAST/IAST
Interest in Security and compliance.
Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
Preferred Technical and Professional Experience
Experience with Agile/Scrum
Excellent verbal/written communications skills and experience interacting with Executive stakeholders
Knowledge and experience of any of the following is an advantage:
CI/CD pipeline, like Jenkins
Open source project
Agile Development process

column6: Perl  Microsoft Azure  Kubernetes  Cloud Computing  Devops  Google Cloud Platform  Software Engineering  Scripting  Amazon Web Services  Unix  Python  Continuous Integration  Cloud  Ansible  Java  Databases  Linux  C++
column7:
Job Responsibilities:
Work on diversified cloud Platforms consisting of Databases and CICD, Logging, and monitoring tools.
Automate manual processes and aim to eliminate them.
Identify and resolve problems relating to critical service operations.
Involve in the design and subsequent implementation of software and service infrastructure.
Perform training about database design modelling as well as ensuring best operational practices across the company.
Job Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or related fields.
At least 2 years of relevant experience with managing IT infrastructure with a focus on the Unix platforms.
Experience with cloud computing technologies from vendors such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platforms.
Knolwedge of the Linux or FreeBSD/OpenBSD family of Operating Systems.
Experience in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Go, or scripting experience in Shell.

column6: Application Architecture  Cloud Computing  Release Management  It Operations  Sql  Application Support  Itil  Incident Management  Troubleshooting  Teaching  Secondary Education  Knowledge Management  Root Cause Analysis  Trend Analysis  Compliance  Pmp
column7:
Well versed with ITIL Concepts - Incident, Problem, Change and Release Management, Knowledge management

Perform and manage incident and event tickets, determine priority, and resolution from Level 1 escalation within defined SLA in compliance to Client's incident management process

Escalate incident and event tickets to Level 3 teams within defined SLA in compliance to client's incident management process

Perform in-depth production incident troubleshooting, resolve any production incident and monitor the fixes to ensure correct resolution.

Provide trend analysis and root cause analysis on recurring incidents and defects

Review and plan continuous improvements to ensure smooth running of the applications

Manage application jobs, and provide instructions to Level 1 Application Operations team for jobs recovery/execution
